text: Love love LOVE Sambalatte!  Vegas has been lacking cafes like this one! I go here multiple times a week and everything has been perfect.  They have many different coffees brewed through various unique processes that make a French press look run of the mill.  Cappuccinos and lattes are full bodied and strong, and they have designs in the foam.  Great hot tea selection available in french press pots, and a delicious iced green yerba mate.  They have sandwiches (good caprese one, heated and served with a side of balsamic) and lots of desserts- including minis (napoleon, eclair, tiramisu cups, etc).  They also have gelato and sorbet, and my husband's all time fav- affogato (gelato with a shot of espresso poured over).  The atmosphere here is charming and warm, and they are open till 10pm wed-sat.  Service is excellent, they always walk upstairs to bring me my drink and are super friendly.  There is free wifi and an entire long table downstairs with multiple plugs for laptops.  Only negative is that I wish they stayed open later on weekends, especially for Vegas 10pm is early to close!

It's an Europian coffee shop where u can sit outside and enjoy your drink.They make good machiato(my husband loves it),delicious and healthy smoothies.I love that ginger peach hot tea..We go there almost 3 times a week.But know that my hus is in vacation we will come often.We take his parents too,cause as Europian we like these kind of places.I forgot to mention it,you don't forget to try the gelato,especially the chocolate one...
Amazing little coffee shop! Loved the atmosphere and the coffee was fantastic! The employees were friendly and even helped play tour guide for my friend and I.

For being one of the most aesthetically pleasing and warm feeling coffee shops I've been to in Vegas; I found it a bit counteracted by a busy upscale location being Boca Park. Which if that's your cup of tea that's fine and I appreciate what it has to offer but as for the Coffee shop at hand it seems like a place you'd find in a nice chill Pacific Northwest town(which is what I like about Sambalatte's atmosphere).

As for the Menu it's all done out fashionably in chalk and looked very well balanced with choices of Coffee, Tea's, Espresso, Iced Coffee, etc.  The thing that stood out to me about the Menu was the fun choices it had the I don't normally see at places such as Coffee Bean & Starbucks. Of course I went with the fun choice off the seasonal menu and was not disappointed. I ordered the Nutcracker (Vanilla, Hazlenut, & Chocolate) and it hit the spot. I'll be the first to admit that I'm not a coffee pro but this was the perfect blend of flavors. Unfortunately my girlfriends Latte' did not live up and was very watery.  

On another note the if you order in you get served in quaint coffee cups that remind me of coffee shops I would pass through in Europe and adds to the overall environment. It's also very accommodating with outlets & sweet furniture galore for you "Lap Top Coffee Shop Folk" and whatever it is that you do ; )

But seriously if you don't mind the Hipsters that roam about the area I really recommend you give it a shot. It's a very nice shop with a menu I know I'll be back to further dive into. Try the Nutcracker while they have it!

This may not be a completely fair review for the business since they can't control everything I have complaints about, but here's my opinion:

We went on a Sat. night, maybe that was our mistake. The tiny place was just packed, and it was very hard to find a table for 4. Finally one opened up, but it was very uncomfortable because we were so closed to everyone else. I rather be in a place that I can feel comfortable in and lounge and talk without inviting everyone into my conversation. Also since it was our first time trying the place, we all ordered a drink and at least one food item each....which did not all fit onto the table. We had to consolidate all the food items onto just a couple of plates. We basically finished our drinks and food and left because of the crowded atmosphere. And I know most people are probably going to hate me for saying this, but I just don't get why all these people are staying around for hours taking up the few tables there are. Honestly, I don't see how you can study or read in a place like this when it's crowded and there is a guy singing in the front. Maybe in the daytime but not on a Sat night. I wish everyone would be more considerate and study at home or a library and get their drinks/food to go. While I was there, I didn't see too many people reordering so basically you're just taking up room that other patrons need.

As for the drinks/food, none of us were impressed. It wasn't bad but it didn't knock our socks off either. The employees weren't super friendly or unfriendly. I don't think I will be returning, I prefer Starbucks or Coffee Bean more, it has a more comfortable and friendlier atmosphere.

I am completely obsessed with this place! Obsessed, obsessed, obsessed!!!!  

A friend suggested this place to meet and study one night during finals week and I was impressed upon arrival.  Where else in Vegas can you find a cute little indie cafe?  There are couches, tables, and even a loft for people to do their thing at.  It smelled so good in there too!  Just a whiff of it would probably wake you up.   

I wasn't much of a coffee fan before.  I thought it just tasted like mud (or what I would imagine mud to taste like), but then I tried it here.  I got the gingerbread man latte.  It wasn't too sweet and I liked that you could taste the coffee rather than just the gingerbread flavor.  I admit that coffee still isn't my favorite, but if I had to have it anywhere, Sambalatte is where I'll go.  Just a heads up, their espresso shots are strong!! My brother asked for an extra shot in his mocha (I guess that's how he orders at the other places), and the barista warned him that their shots are the equivalent of 3 of the chain coffee houses.  Personally, I like their teas.  They use actual tea leaves and not the diluted tea bags that  everywhere else uses.  My goal is to try every single one they have.  I also like that they have sandwiches, salads, cheese platters, and pastries.  Light lunch anyone??  

The best thing about this place: presentation!!  Two words...FOAM ART!!  It's a simply touch but it can make all the difference.  Let's just call it luxury in a cup!  Their teas are served in a glass tea press.  Again, it's not much, but it's the little things that matter!  

After raving on and on about this place, it goes without saying that I think this is a must try.  Whatever your mood, they'll have something for you.
Luiz , thank you for your amazing customer service!

I've been here maybe 5x over the year I've been in Vegas.  Love the atmosphere and outside tables but after living in Portland, OR - the coffee really is overpriced and nothing special. Takes awhile to get coffee. Place is more about atmosphere than coffee that just amazes.

I would've given them just a star but I'm giving them credit for their coffee. Customer service is unbelievably terrible. Patiently waited for our food (ham & cheese croissant and Italian cold cut) and waited for 40 mins! Staff wasn't apologetic. Just asked us if we want a refund (their way to fix things). Get it together and up your customer service skills! What makes you think we will just be happy for a refund when we waited for this long for a sandwich that doesn't even take that long to make?!?

I'm tempted to tell you all that Sambalatte is terrible so that you'll leave it all to me, but that would be almost criminal. This place is a jewel in Las Vegas, and exactly what I've been hoping to find in nearly ten years living here. 

Excellent, independent shop with top quality coffee. A real antidote to the cookie cutter, cardboard Starbucks monotony. Sambalatte is just about the only place in the US I've come across that can make an authentic Flat White, a delicious coffee drink popular in Australia and New Zealand. They also have a wide selection of teas and sweetened drinks, though I have not tried these.

The service staff are primarily young people and, as some have said, maybe a little bit rough, but I notice it getting better all the time. There is a nice selection of pastries, fruit and meat trays, even a few sandwiches like good-quality ham and brie on crusty bread with champagne mustard. 

The atmosphere has a cool vibe. There are current magazines from around the country, and newspapers, and free wi-fi. There are two floors of indoor seating and seating outside, too, with free standing heaters for the cooler weather. 

The owner is almost always on site, which is no doubt, why the quality has remained consistently high on each of my visits. 

I can recommend Sambalatte highly.

First yelp review I have written! This place deserves a 5 star rating. I love the atmosphere, the serving staff, the drinks and the food. Great wifi connection. I have tried the wraps, pastries, snacks and many drinks. I am never disappointed.
This is the go to place when friends from my LA hometown visit.

The place was spotttttlesss and the cappuccino was wonderful!  

Good service and a beautiful, peaceful, and elegant place :D

I will go there every time I come to Vegas!

Independent coffee shops remind me of when my friends and I would cafe-hop while studying for finals. Unfortunately, they're a rare kind here in Vegas, but Sambalatte is the closest thing to what I've been searching for!

There's no doubt that their latte art is eyecatching, but sometimes the flavor's lost in their drinks. That said, I enjoyed their mocha latte, but their famous Nutella latte was a bit of a watery letdown. Their matcha green tea latte never fails to lure me, but the price prevents me from caving in to temptation. I'll treat myself to it one day.

Their macarons have me hooked. Vibrantly colored with a flavor to match, these meringue morsels have a diameter slightly longer than that of a half dollar. Hands down, their mango macaron is my absolute favorite. My only wish is that they were a smidge bigger for their $1.50 price tag, but I understand these delicate sweet treats are difficult to make.

With its comfortable atmosphere and mellow hipster vibe, this cafe welcomes anyone from the sole person equipped with a laptop to a couple on a coffee date. Makes for an ideal people watching spot (if you're into that), so grab a latte, take a seat, and enjoy.

I love this place for a leisurely morning chat with a friend or for researching and studying like I am doing today. Tried the Nutella latte (with almond milk) for the first time. Delish! I think I have a new favorite!

My home away from home. Sambalatte overs a hip, cozy atmosphere while serving some of the best coffee I've had. They have large tables with outlets so you can slide up and get some work done. They're dirty chai tea is amazing!!!! Everyone there is very friendly and knowledgable. LOVE THIS PLACE. Oh, they also have live entertainment most nights. Best part....it's within walking distance from my house!

Love love love all the coffee/tea/& treats! But the barista working when I went in was NOT accommodating at all. I used to work in a very similar atmosphere so I'm understanding, but not being "allowed" to give my a cup of hot water is ridiculous. I'd already purchased tea & biscotti and was in need of more hot water. 

Ruined the whole thing for me, especially since it was my first time there.

Mediocre coffee...decent pastry...nice staff....but prices are ridiculous. 

You are basically paying a premium to drink coffee amongst summerlin milfs.

WTH is going on with this place?  I went yesterday afternoon and had the best view of a soap opera unfold from my seat upstairs.

Some middle aged blonde woman came stomping up the stairs looking very determined, went into the employees only locked room, and I heard shouting. A different lady came out looking surprised, but the shouting continued so I assume she wasn't the main target.

After another few minutes, a younger guy came out and stomped down the stairs.  At this point I was totally enthralled, so I moved seats downstairs to see what else would happen.  My mind is racing trying to figure out the dynamic and what's going on. and nobody noticed I was eavesdropping lol

From downstairs listening to the baristas, I was able to deduce that the blonde woman, either Sherry or Sheila, was the owner and she just fired the manager for one of her own mistakes and they were all reeling from it.  Something about payroll.. so now they're all filing wage disputes.  The kid upstairs I guess stood up to her and was fired too..

This place takes the Fun out of Dysfunction. I don't know who was right in the scenario, but yikes.  I wouldn't want to work here.  Coffee was okay.

3.5 stars for the drinks, they're good but nothing amazing. 

2.5 for the price. Way over priced for what you get. A latte should never cost $5.50. Coming from San Diego where we have Bird Rock coffee that blows this place away, and is cheaper, it is what it is. I'd only recommend this place if it's convenient.
The drinks are always hot and served quick.  The 'trainee' who I assumed was the owner, was pleasant and friendly.  I really enjoy this place.

I am a San Diegan and there we have tons of cute and comfy coffee shops to choose from. I am thrilled to have found Sambalatte, it really has a nice cozy feel with many unique ways to order your coffee (cold drip, french press, and several others that I can't remember). My fiance and I both had Nutella cappucino's, they were perfect. 
I will definitley be going back to this delighful coffee shop. Next time I will have to order a dessert (they all look so tempting).
Very quiet setting. A great place to gather with friends for the social vibe. Or, even if you're out solo... catch up on some reading or simply to enjoy the hospitality this venue has to offer.
Always a great stop first thing in the morning.   You'd think they'd get mad at me asking them to make me something new, but they always suprise me with something awesome and a smile.
i love this place. they have live music sometimes on weekend . their coffee and pastries are the best in town.
Nice atmosphere to enjoy your morning coffee and start your day. Pricey but worthed

My husband is the coffee drinker of the two of us but I have been to Sambalatte on a couple occasions for meetings and have enjoyed their atmosphere. The staff is friendly and the location has a nice big parking lot. On the weekends this place is packed so I recommend going during the week.

I usually order the one smoothie they have on the menu which is large and filling but still a bit expensive. My husband likes the coffee but says that he has had better for the price as well.

Different Coffee versus Starbucks taste. The atmosphere is very relaxed. It's more of a place where you go hang out rather than on the go. The moment you step into the boho-chic shop you won't feel in Vegas anymore. Prices aren't too steep for a cup ofJo and their teas are delicious as well. I reccomend everyone try it whether your looking for drinks or Just a place to hang!

The space is absolutely adorable! There was live music on Sunday afternoon, and plenty of tables available without being too crowded together. 
The espresso was delicious, and the staff was attentive and pleasant. I ordered macarons as well; $1.75 a pop, which was a bit expensive for not fresh-baked (they were cold and chewy; not my preference, but they were good enough).

Sambalatte will satisfy every espresso lover and coffee enthusiast. Located in  Boca Park, they offer deliciously brewed coffee, food and teas at competitive prices. Walking through the door, the aroma of coffee beans and fresh baked pastries make your mouth water.  They have a great selection of desserts - ooh so pretty.   Great people watching as you can sit inside or enjoy the nice spring air outside.  Finally, you can relax and sip while enjoying the moments that make life worth living.

Reviews aren't lying about Sambalatte's coffee and food. It's all definitely good. Definitely costs though. If you want to come here a lot, you'll realize its a vacuum for your wallet, since their Wifi password changes daily and you have to pay for something to obtain it.

The cashiers do not seem knowledgeable about whats being served on a given day or what they're out of. My guess is that they've hired too many of them, keep them on a revolving-door shift schedule of a few hours a week, and thus when they show up for work, have no idea what's going on. Baristas and servers are generally friendly though.

The novelty of this place wears off when you realize it's constantly busy and thus, hard as f*ck to find a seat here. Especially if you have a laptop and want to study. Yeah, don't study here. You'll find lots of hipsters eagerly wanting to show off their newly acquired $1300+ status symbol products, a.k.a Macbooks, and brandishing them without any sort of case protection whatsoever on these investments. Also lots of inconsiderate idiots who occupy seats at the tables with outlet strips even though they have no electronics. There's a TV upstairs for some reason - no idea why it's on since the music and chatter is so loud anyway and I'm of the opinion coffeehouses shouldn't have TVs anyway.

Such a cool spot. Sambalatte has great coffee. I tried the french press and have to say that I was very impressed. The baristas know their coffee and recommended a very nice blend for me. 
The atmosphere is very relaxed. They have lounge music playing in the background with no lyrics which makes it perfect for studying or just conversing with a friend. 
They have electrical outlets everywhere! 
Keep up the good work

Prices are as expected. Food is definitely an LA feel and different for Vegas. Patrick, our server wouldn't take the time to tell I which flavors of macaroons they had so we went to the back of the line on a busy morning. We look at the small sign and half the names don't show and when we told him we can't see him he just kept looking at us so ended up guessing which flavors they had. Didn't even take the time to guess some or even grab the sign and show it to us. On a brighter note I went back in line the 3rd time and he did make a joke saying, "back for more?" which made me laugh a bit. This was my first time here.

Can't say enough about the quality of the coffee and amenities. First-off, know that I am a coffee snob. A recent transplant from Chicago, Intellagentsia was my go-to for a great cup. Starbucks is something I get when I am in a hurry. True coffee must be enjoyed. This is where Sambalaltte excels! Choose between french press, siphon or chemex brew styles (which makes a huge difference in the outcome) and excellent coffee selections and you have your custom coffee dream. The staff is perfectly willing to talk you thru if you are a newbie and when they are not crazy-busy usually deliver to the table. The lattes are rich and luxurious and the espresso con panna was to die for. We split a breakfast quiche which was tender and flaky and enough for two. An awesome loft-style store contains long tables with outlets if you want to surf away the morning on your laptop. Upstairs has a library-like feel if you just want to sit and veg-out. But go for the coffee... it truly is the best in Las Vegas.

I thought Sambalatte had me before, now I am fully committed!  The vegetable quiche...a vegetarian's dream come true.  Slow drip tower coffee for those who just like good coffee but with an extra umph!  Cranberry scones...the best I've had.  Peach ginger tea is great on these hot days, fresh fruit is always a treat with a good variety, portion and quality.  The atmosphere is unique to Vegas and feels like I escaped for a few minutes!  The customers aren't the juvenile crowd that gathers at Starbucks, rather those who do some serious reading, and there's a separate table for computer-ers.  I am annoyingly specific and I seem to always have a gripe about something everywhere but I feel like they deserve my money!

Determined to find a coffee shop that offered free wi-fi, caffeine to feed my habit, a chill five, and a decent work space, I started a mission to try every coffee shop in Vegas. Excluding Starbucks and Coffee Bean, I have been to 8 different places, and Sambalatte is definitely a top contender.

Why I love it: 
Any place that can give me a tasty Nutella flavored, caffeinated drink immediately earns my love. They made my drink look pretty - major presentation points. There were plenty of outlets at the communal table so my millennial self could bring my laptop and get some work done. The live music that started around 6:30 pm the Tuesday evening I was there gave me some free.99 entertainment (However, this would be terribly distracting if I wasn't the type of person that requires loud noise to focus). 

What could make it even the more awesome: I could use more table space, but I know I'm just a table hog. I did my best to confine myself within a small amount of space at the communal table, but my neighbor managed to bump into me a couple times.

Really has great coffee and MORE! Luis, owner, from Brazil is working to make a flawless coffee house in the grand Latin American upscale tradition. When everything is perfect, I believe Luis is going to duplicate his Sambalatte 'Masterpiece' round Vegas, then USA, then out of country. Watch Sambalatte grow! Luis really is a perfectionist. Great baristas Paul, Jamie, Vlad, Cedric, Mason take their jobs very very seriously in creating the best coffee you will ever have in Las Vegas.
Try the Iced Coffee made with drip from the 'Tower.' Very tasty with lots of kick. FACT: Desserts are flown in from PARIS daily!
Don't drink coffee but I would definitely come back for one. A variety of items, will try something new everytime I come by

I changed my mind about this place. I like it. Its a bit on the pricey side but you get what you pay for I suppose. They have great coffee and nice ambience with all of the books. There is also an upstairs area that I have never ventured to. Why don't you check it out for me :-)

Had the flat white which was the first time that I've had a coffee that didn't have any sugar in it and didn't miss it. It was very smooth and not bitter. They have a variety of methods for making coffee and the store is very relaxing. The salmon quiche was also very tender and the crust was flaky. Very expensive for a small cup of coffee, but definitely worth a try.
Love meeting my friends here for a cup of coffee. I can bring my dogs here also which is a plus. I love their cappuccino. So creamy and decadent. I get it as my dessert after dinner sometimes

Expensive but tastey desserts. Decent service. Cool atmosphere.  Coffee is expensive everywhere I guess.  Not the only place with expensive cup of Joe lol 
Sometimes they have a live musician. Not bad. They have a few locations but I prefer the summerlin one.

I can appreciate a place to enjoy intriguing beverages that is anywhere other than starbucks. I love the books on the shelf and the big table up top to hold a study if I needed. When entering the business I noticed two energies.. laid back, wifi enjoying guest who keep noise at a minimum and fast paste employees by the registry who made sure I wasn't surprised with my order since I don't prefer caffeine.  Anyways! Great place if you haven't been in, it's highly in couraged!

Awesome coffees and teas but the food could be a bit more, ummm, let's say, well put together. The cheese plates have an awkward combo of cheeses that don't really go together, nor are entirely meant for mass eating, beyond just a bite or two. The sanwiches are very bare, way too much bread for what's in between, and while the pastries have amazing presentation, many taste freezer-burnt. The service to actually get your coffee once it's ordered is ridiculously slow, they really need to iron that out soon!!! And the plates are way too big, they need to find a way to condense things onto one plate esp for meats, cheeses, etc. The coffee prices aren't too bad as the coffees are amazing, but the food prices are highway robbery especially for what they're giving. The location, ambiance & people are great so I'm sure they'll continue to do well, but with their outrageous prices, I think the novelty will wear off & business will drop when people realize they have other great choices in Vegas for literally half the cost.

Finding this gem made me want to move to Summerlin. Really though, I can't get enough of the macaroons, soups and extensive varieties of teas. The baguettes and veggie croissant-wiches appeal to Euro and American palates alike. 

The atmosphere is perfect for a day of studying, or catching up with old friends. The proximity to REI and TotalWine is not too shabby as well. 

It's so refreshing to know that local coffee shops like this still exist. Sambalatte feels like home.

This was my first visit to Sambalatte and I was not disappointed! My group and I ordered a large black coffee, a large mocha frappe, and a regular sized mocha. My total came to around $15 which is average, if not better, than other places; however, for the quality, $15 is a steal! The mocha was creamy and rich, and came in a beautiful mug with the latte art atop. The black coffee was delicious and smooth. The mocha frappe contained more coffee (espresso?) than other places, with less chocolate, which made it the creamiest and most delicate balance I've ever tasted!
I will certainly be back to try out more of the menu here!

I love sambalatte. My first visit was at jones store. The store is slower than the one in here, I love both places ambiance and their coffee. The only thing I give them a 4 stars if they can train their associates better. Most of them don't know the product their selling. I remember this is also happen at jones store. The cashier need to keep asking the manager if we can do that. I asked them can I do rainbow latte with almond milk and the cashier said yes of coz, than later the barista was telling me it is only possible with whole milk. And I am allergic to whole milk. So I am kinda disappointed that I didn't get rainbow latte. Plus their art is nothing spectacular. The reason I go to local coffee shop not only cause of the ambiance and good coffee but also the coffee art and in here is just a regular heart. Prefer 5 lattee. All heart so boring
I always make the trip here for coffee when I'm in Vegas.  Usually I get the iced coffee or tea.  Food items they serve are also very good.  Never a bad experience here.  I wish they had one in CA.
A little pretentious at times. Food and pastries are a little overpriced.  But it's the best coffee in Las Vegas.  It's so good.  You won't be disappointed in the coffee.

The best coffee house in Summerlin and so badly needed. Great service, coffee drinks, pastries, snacks and gelato. They support other small local businesses and doing their part to be as eco-savvy as possible. My wife and I sat here for 2hrs just relaxing and reading. Thanks to Luiz for creating a coffee haven.

In the mood for a great cup of coffee? This is probably the best, yes I'm saying it, the BEST spot in Vegas. After drinking waaaaay too much so called "coffee" confections from the big boys, I have a newfound love for this roasted tastiness. It's the simple things that make this place so great. Quality of the product, process and services with a touch of atmosphere makes this a must and one of Vegas' unique locals to chill and spend time with your fellow sippers.
Always love coming here. Great drinks and great customer service! The atmosphere is always so relaxing as well. I recommend everyone to come here :)
When in Vegas, I visit Sambalatte.  Some of the best coffee around.  I crave the iced coffees here.  Legit coffee shop with some great light foods.

Nice decor.  Probably a place that I may meet a friend for coffee.  Service was just OK.  The coffee drinks (I ordered a nonfat iced mocha, husband had a nonfat iced hazelnut latte) were actually quite good.  I also had my 2 kids in tow this afternoon, each ordered a chocolate milk.  I had to go back to the counter after waiting over 15 minutes for the kids' drinks.  Seems as though they brought the 2 choc. milks to another table????  Guy in back of counter making coffee was annoyed....gave cashier an attitude and told her to make the drinks because he made them already??
Anyway, we did get the kids' drinks...plus 4 little sugar cookies!!! (complimentary due to the choc. milk wait)....

I'm changing my review! yay! I wanted to love Sambalatte and now I do!
I was disappointed the last few times I went, because the coffee was weak, the prices were insane, and the customer service was not excellent.
I left for school and came back for winter break it is really changed.

The barista that helped me was excellent. I wish I had gotten his name, but he is the tall guy with the beard. He explained why they do not have dark roast coffees, and he actually seemed to care about coffee. 
Not to mention he actually asked me what size coffee I wanted (and didn't just charge me for a large, which is what happened to me 2 or 3 times before). 
The coffee was brewed to perfection. Plus, I love the to-go cups. They are integrated with a coffee sleeve as part of the cup. I am all about the little details, those were pretty cool. 

The atmosphere is still amazing. The barista just made it great though. I'll get his name next time and put it on here. 

Still my only complaint is that the food has no prices! Makes it feel like they are trying to scam customers a little. 

But overall it has really changed for the better!

The staff, coffee and preparation made my first a wonderful and educational experience!

I came to Las Vegas for my friends 50th birthday and before I left home (Burlingame, CA) I searched the internet to find a specialty coffee house. I had yet to find any coffee in Las Vegas on the strip that would satisfy my thirst for flavorful, delicious espresso and coffee pours and hoped this is what I was looking for, it is!!

We arrived and was excited to see the different brewing methods in action! The couple I was with had never been to a place such as this and they were treated to one of the best cups of coffee (pour over) and a latte they had ever had. I had an espresso to start and then finished with a cap with my wife, both superb!!!

Not only was the coffee and ambiance fantastic but the knowledge of the Batista's excellent. They took time to explain to me how they pulled shots, since I wanted to understand how I can improve mine, and talked about the different flavors you can get and taste. They were doing a vacuum brew for a customer and explaining the process and was lucky enough to have another customer say how amazing the coffee was.

This is the best place in Vegas and will be making out there every time I am in town!!

$5 for a small latte. Nothing fancy, just espresso and milk. I don't think that's "$" for a coffee shop. Anyway, slowest- SLOWEST- service I've ever had in a coffee shop and I've been to Starbucks on a Saturday. I was here after lunch, mid day on a Thursday and the employees were literally dragging their feet, moving like they got paid by the minute and not too friendly. All that and coffee is bitter. If I hadnt paid for it, I'd have tossed it. Not impressed.
Omir. 5 star service above and beyond expectations.guy deserves a raise. Tip him well

I absolutely love the environment of this place and the selection of coffee bean. The upstairs loft area is like your own little private world to relax when it's not busy. I ordered a pour over. Although it wasn't executed correctly, I still enjoyed my experience. I highly recommend this place and would of given it five stars had my pour over been executed properly

The service was bad and the people behind the counter were not knowledgeable about the food items on the menu. I waited 20 minutes for a breakfast sandwich and iced latte. They got my order wrong and had to wait another 10 minutes for my drink. By the time I got my drink, my sandwich was cold. It was overpriced for subpar food.

My new favorite coffee shop!  I love the feeling you get when you walk in here...like to should plan to stay for a few hours and relax while having a fancy coffee/tea, and the pastries they have are delicious! Great prices. Just watching them make the drinks feels like an adventure...I love it!  The design in my coffee made me smile :)  Well worth going!
I love it here! Incredible coffee, great staff, and the chill atmosphere makes it the perfect spot for meetings. Coffee as it should be.

Perfect spot in summerlin for reading/homework/laptop time

Love the vibe of this place. Coffee is great, and tons of spots to plug in laptops. I almost always get an Americano, which is a little over $2. Great spot!
A very good cafe with well balanced roasts . The ambiance is pretty good. I recently discovered this place. Skip the chains and get a real brew.
As good as they get.... outside of Vienna in the 80's. Portland can wait.

A real coffee house. Each cup is individually brewed and is amazing. The coffee beans they get are great. The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. If you are a huge coffee fan you will fall in love with this place after one visit. If you are not that big into coffee this place will change your coffee drinking experience. Make sure to drop by and grab a cup, for under $2.50 you can't beat it, and the coffee beats anything I have had in Las Vegas hands down.

1 star for the cute setup.  It's a cozy place to meet friends or study.  I paid almost $30 for a cappuccino, coffee, quiche and a ham and brie sandwich.  Definitely over priced for the lacking quality of food and service.  Coffee was okay, and my ham and brie sandwich had more cheese rind than brie.  I'll pass next time.

Came here two nights ago, and it closes at 8:( so I drove from the strip area to grab a beverage and pastry before work and I am so glad I did! The almond croissant is of the Richter scale! Definitely will be back, the environment is perfect for catching up with a friend or even catching up on some work! I got the white mocha which was good but I definitely will be back to try some of the other things like the Nutella cappuccino!!

I absolutely looooooooove this place!!
The coffee tasted strong and fresh. The staff is very nice!
$5.25 for a small latte, which I was told that wasn't sweetened but it was. Nuff said!!

Can't say enough wonderful things about this place. Wonderful atmosphere. Amazing coffee. Great "treat" drinks (we tried the Nutella latte) and delectable light bites (quiche). The atmosphere reminded me of places I'd frequent in Chicago.

I love the seating and electrical outlet availability in this shop.  Also the live music and ambiance is great.  The only reason I gave it 3 stars is the prices.  The prices are astronomical for what you are getting.  I can go a few doors down and get a meal at Cheesecake Factory for the same price as a sandwich and a drink (or a dessert and a drink) here. I would definitely go and spend more time if it was a bit more affordable.

My favorite cafe in town! Amazing flavor and amazing loft upstairs for workspace! You need to come try this place out! The staff is very fun and energetic! They also bring in live music which is very relaxing while I drink and work. I love that they support local music as well!
Just about the best coffee and enviroment in Las Vegas . Great Vibe . Internet & plenty of space inside 2 levels and outdoor seating .
Great place  for coffee with a lot of ppl.. The coffee was delicious but the music was noisy..

Okay, I received a message from management apologizing about the situation, which was such a sweet gesture. I realize I probably looked like a bipolar (undiagnosed of course!) lunatic for the novel I wrote about the RUDE pianist and their unconcerned staff (I posted pics and everything! I guess I was really pissed and was led by emotions, which I try to avoid when yelping). I apologize to Sambalatte for that and I thank you for reaching out to me. 

I still don't think I will go back to this location, but the fact that they took the time to reach out and acknowledged the situation proves they care about their business and patrons.  Thank you!

If anything I'll send my friend who would be good business since she spends a lot at Starbucks. I was brand new to Sambalatte, so I don't feel as though I'm losing too much by not returning. But for you other yelpers, this place is pretty cool and worth checking out. The management cares and the concept is unique for a coffee house. This location is worth a try at least once! They have another in the south, so I may try that one if I find myself in the area. I don't plan to frequent though, because I live in summerlin. =/

Kudos to Sambalatte management!

This is a great, locally owned, coffee house. The service is impeccable and the coffee and food is outstanding. I've been here twice, and both times it was packed. This is truly what a local coffee joint should be. Well done!

This place is truly like no other coffee shop in Vegas. It's got a very traditional, Seattle-ish (not that I've ever been but this is what I would imagine) atmosphere to it. The Benneton Club and I went there on Sunday afternoon after catching a movie, it was rainy (maybe that is where I got the Seattle association from) and it was the perfect place to sit and watch the rain. They've got little park-like benches inside with some chairs and a community table for those working on lap tops. I peaked upstairs real quick and got a look at some more table and chairs on that level. 

Oh, I'm sorry - my vanilla latte was DELICIOUS and it came with a heart on top which officially bumped them back up to 5 stars in my book.

The only downgrade was that their blenders were not up and working yet so I could not get a fru-fru drink but I wanted something warm on this dreary day regardless.

I'd totally recommend spending any Sunday afternoon reading the day away at Sambalatte.

Excellent coffee.  We've been coming here for several years.  It's totally out of the way (we live in the Green Valley area) but it's a nice little road trip and if we get the comfy seats upstairs we can sit and read for some time.  I've never had a bad drink here.  I typically get a mocha with almond milk.  But it's all fantastic.  I love the ambiance, it's just a really cool little shop.  The only cons, besides it being super busy, is that it can get pricey for a coffee drink and over the past year I've noticed the quality of customer service going down.  Wrong drinks etc.  Mostly, overall good customer service in general seems to be lacking.  If it continues we'll use the Jones location, not as inviting but......
Still love this place. One of the few authentic coffee shops in Vegas. The menu is pretty extensive, from breakfast to sammie's to decadent desserts.

Charming place, friendly staff, knowledgable baristas good at latte art. Throw in free wi-fi. Score!!! This place is busy definitely not your "quick cup and go" place but worth every penny if you have time to sit back, relax and enjoy.

I've been coming to Sambalatte once a month for about two years. I live on the opposite side of the city, but this is an excellent place for me to meet up with friends who live in Summerlin. The coffee and specialty drinks can tend to be a bit more pricy than you're used to at other coffee shops, but I've never been disappointed with quality. The staff has also been kind and courteous on each trip. While I don't recommend this for your every day coffee habit, Sambalatte is a nice indulgence.

This place reminds me of a coffee shop in New York City. It is cool, comfortable, creative and everything is delicious. For a coffee shop, they have a wide range of offerings if you are hungry. They offer coffee from around the world. They steep it in such a way that you get all the flavors that you are paying for. The seating environment is appealing. If you want to get out of your house, take your computer and just be creative; this is the place for you. 

For me, it is a long drive so when I go I make the day out of it. I sit, I write, I sip. This is a great place and I'm glad it is here.

I use to love it here when it first opened and i meet the owner & his wife. But now it is way overcrowded. The coffee taste burnt but is pretty. The last time i was here i had the man taking my order talk down to me. I know the ways espresso is served (not just starbucks) like he said. I do not need a 17 year old being extremely rude to me ABOUT COFFEE. No thanks.

I usually go here to hangout, write, and from time to time bring my laptop to type instead of studying because it can get really loud during busy hours.  Sambalatte has an exceptional quality of coffee compared to other places. All in all, it's a great coffee shop with friendly staff.

After having yummy coffee in Portland, Oregon I was on a search to find something similar in Las Vegas. Suffice to say that Sambalatte fit the the bill. The staff is friendly and willing to answer any questions you may have without the "you should know the answer" attitude. Always a plus in my book I must say. This place is always busy. Since finding Sambalatte on Yelp I have managed to visit many times I have lost count. That's how great this place is. I have had the mocha latte as well as the chocolate cappuccino. Both delicious and they  look so beautiful you just want to admire from afar but can't help yourself to drinking them. The french macarons are good and so is the chocolate croissant. You sort of just want to stay there all day with a cup of coffee in  one hand. My daughter also enjoyed her hot chocolate with marshmallows and she also tried some sort of smoothie, which I also had a taste of she loved it as well.

A comfortable, chill spot in Summerlin.  Interior personally reminds me of something found in downtown Philadelphia.  It does not have a "Vegas" feel to it.

There is usually a line, but worth it.  Definitely dont assume you're going to rush in and out of there with a beverage.  They provide a variety of brewing methods and small treats.  Seating is available, but limited.  People like to homestead there, but its a coffee shop, expect it.  WiFi access is provided with a purchase.

Its also ideally situated for errand runners with a Target, Whole Foods, and etc close by.  I did see they are either moving or establishing an additional spot in southwest Vegas.

A great place to hang out, networking or basically just doing some works!. Free Wi-Fi. Great Interior and atmosphere,  and the important thing is Great Coffee !. I always order Sumatra.

Once in a while I order the desserts, they are amazing !

Fantastic people and even better espresso! As close to what you'll find in Rome, without going to Italy.  All the baked goods and gelato are excellent.  Highly recommend you stop in for any of their offerings.  A++

Heard a lot about the place and we wanted to check it out. My wife had a siphon coffee, I had just a decaf with a small pastry, and we bought some chocolate.
We usually get our coffee at Starbucks; and I am not a coffee connoisseur, but I have to say: "Sambalatte is the best coffee I ever had". It is not a cheap place, but if you want cheap coffee you shouldn't come here anyway. We will definetely be back.

Great coffee place, especially if ur sick of Starbucks. The chocolate muffin and ham and cheese croissant were awesome. Coffee is made by hand n not in a coffee maker. Each cup is made one-by-one. Special!!
It's super expensive and the coffee isn't consistent. I don't recommend going there but the vibe of the place is nice! There just extending to big to fast!
Maybe the best Affogato I had. Excellent Espresso.

This is my second time here and I love it. Today I wanted what I had the last time which was a meat and cheese platter with fruit. They didn't have that plate so they made me one fresh.  It wasn't exactly the same because their center cup was filled with pecans instead of apricot. But no big deal. It was  great. This is now my go to place when I have time. So much better than StarStrucks.

Completely addicted to this place!!! We just got back from our family vacation and we stopped by Sambalatte every morning during our stay. Our drinks were always on point as well as our pastries! But what stood out to me the most was the friendliness of the staff!! So, it was a great experience all around and will def make it our breakfast spot from now on during our stays in Vegas!!

Nice environment with an upstairs small library. Great place to catch up with morning activities. I had an iced coffee and a ham and cheese croissant. Great portions even tho it was a little pricey $16 for both. Great place.

Me and my husband had hot cocoa, quiche lorraine and vegetable croissant today. First time at this coffee shop and we were  dissapointed. I think we wasted our time and money. We like the ambiance, sandwich tasted really fresh but flavor and taste so with the quiche was very ordinary. I know Einstein and Panera bread was a whole lot better for 1/2 or 1/3 of the price. Hot cocoa was very good though. Im not satisfied with service of the barrista. They find my order of hot cocoa confusing  and theyre making fun of it within my hearing range. I believe that was rude. Am not going back there though i live around the neighborhood!

Are all coffee shops created equal?  36 hours ago, I would've generally agreed.  Then I went to this place.  How can this place be different?  Well, it's tucked in an unassuming upscale shopping center in Summerlin.  I saw they didn't just have the regular 2 flavors like the big green Seattle place, but they had 7.  Hmmm.  Impressive, but they must be sitting on the warmer all day I thought.  Then I ordered and watched them.  Well, she got the beans out and ground them.  Put a filter over a mug.  Put the grinds in the filter... you get the idea.  She made my coffee to order.  No warmers around.  I saw some dude getting some tray of grapes, cheeses, etc.  Gelatto.  They had a huge choice of teas.  Damn, this place is solid.  I'll be back, but I can see this place always being packed like it was when I was there.
I love their lavender latte! This place gets PACKED so grab any open seat you can find and enjoy.

If you actually enjoy tasting your coffee don't go here. First they do not weigh their beans for the pour over. Second they just pour any random amount of water into the coffee and it is usually way too much water. Third the temperature is way too low for any kind of coffee. There is a science to pour overs and a correct water to bean ratio, they ignore both. It's seriously terrible here. It's a cool place to hang out but other than that I'd say avoid at all cost. Try Madhouse or Public Us if you actually love coffee. If you're a wanna be hipster who loves to sit outside drinking crap coffee and looking cool then this is the place for you.

If you love espresso, cappuccino , etc... this is the place for you !  The coffee selections are wonderful and the ambience is perfect. I live in Anthem and I find that the drive to Summerlin is well worth the distance .

Atmosphere is four stars, service is one star, people are three, live music is really bad - one star, menu and prices are three, coffee is average coffee shop fare, food is decent - overall, I like hanging out and working there (with ear buds in) but they screw up orders - out of the last dozen orders I've made there, three times I had to ask them when I was going to get my food or drink 15-20 minutes after I paid for it, only to find that they never started it and completely forgot to even start making it. The Beat is much better - if this place wasn't 20 minutes closer, I'd never go.

My first time here..I originally wasn't going to order anything but I came they originally to check out the atmosphere since I work in Boca Park and have never stopped in. 

There was a musician playing beautiful music live so I tipped him! He was the best part of the entire experience. Lots of random books throughout the place. It's nicely lit but still dim to give it a chill vibe. I love that there's an upstairs too. I would suggest maybe a couch or two for even more comfort. 

BUT...I decided to order since I spent a good amount of time in there. My order was very simple. I wanted a small black tea. That's all. The boy who took my order (light skin,blonde-ish hair, friendly) made my my tea. After I paid and left the counter I went to the side to grab some napkins and a little sugar. When I smelled my coffee it smelled nothing like black tea. Almost like a autumn spiced tea of some sort. I tasted it; not black tea. I opened the lid and the entire tea bag was opened and spilled throughout my tea. It was gross. I couldn't even drink it even though I felt bad for wasting it. I know the boy knew it was like that too because he looked a bit tense when he handed me my tea. 
I asked the boy about their soup of the day. He looked confused, then went and looked into their fridge (why would fresh soup be kept in a fridge and not a warm pot?) he then told me they were all out. Which was fine, I just didn't like the thought of the soup I almost got to be warmed up in a microwave. 
Cute place to study but I won't order from them.

I like Sambalatte a lot.  The location is in the middle of the west side, the staff is pleasant and helpful, the selection is exceptional.

I like Sambalatte because it is almost pitch-perfect in its conception and location - and my few exceptions (detailed below) are really quite minor.  It isn't an expensive coffee shop that should really just sell-out to Starbucks, and it isn't thrown together at all.

Sambalatte takes OCD to the max when it comes to its product.  Among its many selections are pastries worthy of royalty brought in fresh daily, sandwiches on baguette and soups, even a delightful selection of cookies and biscuits.  However, the real strength comes from its coffee.

I am by no means a coffee connoiseur, but Sambalatte makes me question that statement.  Not only are there a number of fine locally-roasted brews available seasonally and the standard lattes performed like art, Sambalatte also has options for the adventurous.  My favorite is the chemistry set that can be used to brew fresh coffee table-side for that special Ethiopian Yergacheffe.

I am a tea connoiseur, and, other than some persnicketiness that comes with knowing a product well, I find that Sambalatte puts most other cafes to shame with its selection of fine loose teas.  You'll only find a larger selection at Teavana or Tea Station, and neither has the ambience (Teavana is not a cafe.).

There are a few things that keep it from being the only place I drive fifteen minutes to for coffee, tea and pastries.

1. Despite the large selection of quality loose tea and a near obsessive attention to detail, Sambalatte's method for brewing these teas is a coffee press.  This may seem like a small detail, but teas over-brew if not removed completely from water.  Also, the number of ready-to-pour iced teas is limited, but good.  A non-ready-made chai would also be nice (Picky, I know, but worthy suggestions for a place that gets so much right.).

2. The seating in Sambalatte is not my favorite.  Other than cafe tables and chairs, the "cozy" seating is largely outdoor furniture (comfortable), including a pair of park benches.

3. The final gripe I have is about price.  Now, I'll be honest, I am the guy who will hang at a coffee house for hours, taking advantage of cheap refills, but Sambalatte's pricing is pretty steep in some areas.  For one, a perfectly good iced tea at the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf will run about $2.80 for 32oz. at Sambalatte you get about 20oz. for the same.  Also, most of the pastries are between $4-6 and a plate of antipasto can run $18.  

The main thing is I am, and will remain, a regular customer.

This was the 3rd visit to Samba Latte. Though their prices are a little high, the atmosphere and quality of espresso are great. Owning a coffee shop myself (MugShots JAVA, Prattville, AL), I REALLY appreciate quality and consistency. Each time we've visited, the drinks are EXACTLY the same & super good! 

Service is a bit slower than I prefer, but when we visit, we're not in a hurry, so it's not really an issue for us.

When I went to high school, the cool thing was to hang out at Starbucks and order strawberry Frappuccinos while having serious discussions about how Jennifer dating Aaron was probably the worst idea ever and why having a 4.24 GPA was not good enough for Stanford. My, how times have changed. The high schoolers are still there but now we are embracing latte art and nobody does it better than Sambalatte. 

The cafe is cozy, the baristas are genuine, and of course, the coffee is as gorgeous as it tastes! Grad students huddle over textbooks in the corner, wizened retirees chat about the meaning of life at the counter near the bar, and suburban couples sit outside with their canines. 

My friends from LA that I bring here when they want the "local experience," (you know, the same people who ask you to please hook them up at a nightclub later that day) tell me it's just like Urth Caffe. I've never been to the latter, but I can assume that ours is a step up because the parking is free and the traffic is nonexistent. Win.

Best coffee house in Vegas, hands down. They have it all, from basic to exotic imports that vary weekly, not to mention every conceivable manner in which to brew coffee. Ambiance is awesome and great for working or people watching or listening to the variable live music in the evenings.

Let me start off by saying I've never been here before. I came here and was impressed with the upstairs part of the shop. I ordered a Iced White Mocha and it was amazing it didn't taste burnt like a lot of coffees I drink. It wasn't overpowered by ice either. I loved how sweet it was. I would definitely come back to this place. Definitely a neat coffee shop. Excellent service as well. Everyone is friendly.

Love love love. Beautiful lattes made with organic almond or soy milk for the same price as the GMO drinks at other places? Sign me up. So much better than most coffee houses. Beautifully decorated and fun environment. I wish they served organic coffee as well, then I would never go anywhere else.

Great selections of coffee and tea. Small two story shop filled with hip people. Enjoyed a pot of vanilla rooibos tea, chocolate macaroon tea, smooth jazz and posh people there. Plenty of outlets and free wifi, also magazines and games available... very generous :) Perfect to study if you don't mind a little noise (I study better that way). BTW, owner is friendly Brazilian guy and he seems to really care about where he gets his beans. Definitely come back for more.

Have only been here once so far but I'll be back!

Wonderful coffee, fresh baked goods, relaxing atmosphere, power outlets for laptops etc - and free wi-fi! 

It could possibly be a tad ... "I'm so much more hip and appreciate REAL coffee than you" ... ish ... too soon to tell. But even if it gets a smidge of that I think it will be minor and easily ignored.

This cafe has excellent coffee whether it's the house blends or the barista made espresso drinks.  What tops this place and pushes a 4 star up to a 5 is that they have somehow created an ambiance that compels you to sit and relax for a while, sip rather than guzzle, and to have some quiet time reading (when you're by yourself) or to socialize (when you're with a friend).  So when you order a coffee "for here", they serve it in a nice mug or glass.  Of course if you don't have time to sit and relax, they have "to go" cups for your convenience.  Silly as it may sound, when I'm here, I imagine that I'm in a cafe that is described in that show Rick Steve's Europe.  Keep in mind I'm not saying that they intended it to be a European cafe, I'm just trying to describe how the ambiance takes me to a different place.  This could be different for you. 

About the service, the baristas are very friendly and helpful.  They make your lattes and cappuccinos with finesse (you can see it in many pictures).  They also don't seem like coffee snobs telling you how you should drink your coffee.  They are just really laid back.  They also bus your table but I try bus it myself when I leave.

On to the coffee.  The mocha and white mocha is delicious with the right amount of espresso to milk/foam to sweet ratio and both do not come with whipped cream (which I don't mind).  The cappuccino is delightful with the right foam to espresso ratio.  Finally the house coffee is light to medium roast with a clean finish.  It tastes fine black but I like to add cream and sugar.

The cost is a little high so this is not my regular coffee place.  However, if you're looking for a simple break from the Las Vegas atmosphere and daily grind, I would recommend coming here once in a while. 

Come check it out!  Hopefully you'll have a similar experience that my wife and I have had.

I came back into restaurant and the. Atmosphere is great and cozy. I really want to like this place! The line is still extremely slow!!! There is one coffee girl, one person taking the order and getting your sweets, and one walking around in the back. When the line is long- (hint) pull the person in back  and at least take an order. The many times I have been in here people leave. They stand in line - it doesn't move and decide to leave. Your losing business! Hire more people! 
The person taking the order shouldn't be getting stuff that takes long either. When she gets a muffin and warms it she waits till it is done and moves at a snails pace. If she had help - this would move faster and you would keep more customers !
I love the great coffee and atmosphere provided. Price is well worth it. Glad to see there are great coffee shops in vegas.

This coffee shop might offer very tasty drinks but when they play live music it's very annoying and sometimes way too loud so if you are looking to relax and you want peace and quite this place is not for you

Sambalatte is a great coffee shop in Boca Park! This has become my favorite coffee place to come to and relax and the atmosphere is amazing! I come here to study a lot as well, because there is a second story and a lot of students studying so you meet a lot of cool people. The staff here is very friendly and energetic! Kennedy will always have a bright smile on her face no matter what and the rest of the team is just as great!
Cool trendy place to chill and enjoy great coffee. Definitely need more places like this in Vegas.

Great-tasting espresso in my Americano but harder on my stomach than some. One of their employees in particular, a pretty big tall dude, is fantastically helpful and complimentary, definitely an asset to the place. The pastry section didn't appear to have much in the way of gluten-free options, but I wasn't looking too hard, either. 

If you're there to get on the internet, make sure you can get on before you settle in too much. It took 20 minutes for the network to appear on my computer, and one of my neighbors was having the same problem. 

Just four stars because though they do coffee well and the place is lovely, it's not very cozy. I'm guessing that this could have been on purpose to discourage people from occupying tables for hours in such a busy area, but it could really benefit from a few comfy chairs and sofas. 

When I found this place on yelp the google directions were wrong. This place is in the same lot as Total Wine and the Cheesecake Factory.
I had the Chai latte with soy milk, it was nice and spicy not too sweet.  My friends enjoyed the coffee.  Vegan coconut cookie hit the spot.  The service was friendly and helpful.

The best coffee shop I have ever been too, and the standard by which all others will be judged in my book.

Oh coffee how I love thee!  Let me count the ways.  Literally since there are about 2 dozen different ways to get a single cup of drip here.  Not to mention the really cool cold press machine right on the front counter.

Tried a ham and cheese croissant there and was very surprised that it was homemade.  

Everything was perfect.

I live arnd mountains edge and i drive here to get my coffee fix atleast twice a week since i discovered this awesome gem! i love love their coffee especially the nutella cappuccino, iced white mocha and java chip frappe! Food is great especially their ham and cheese croissant! Great Ambiance! They have outside seating were you can people watch and or meet friends and catch up! I wish they would soon build wish one close to my house along the 215w side! :)

Great vibe, delicious drinks- only complaint was that the tables were dirty and service was slow. Not sure if their employees are supposed to clean up empty cups and dishes but it wasn't happening the day I went there. Great place to grab a drink and chill out though.
Excellent place.  Just a tad small without the usual advantage of being intimate.

Yeaaaah NO. Hipsterville coffee. I felt like I was transported to Portland, Oregon. Overpriced BLAH coffee. I ordered a 16 ounce and was given a 12 ounce and when I asked about it I got attitude and " oh well" instead of them remaking it. I can make better coffee at home.

Love. Love. Love. Great location in Boca park. I love going at night when the trees outside are lite in the parking lot. So many drink options and the macaroons are delicious! Live musicians sometimes too.

This place used to be great. Had good coffee, helpful staff, etc. Now this place is junk. 8 people working yet only two of them are making the drinks. the girl at the register doesn't know how to use the pos, and the other employees are running around doing dishes. not to mention there's alaways a group of people huddled around waiting impatiently for their order. the quality of coffe isn't the same either. tastes as if it's been watered down and they use too much cream. If I'm going to wait 20+ minutes for my coffee it better be good. Just run accross to Von's and get a starbucks coffee or go home and make your own.

Lavender white mocha is good!
Red rock latte is okay, cinnamon overpowered the taste in mine.
Matcha soy latte was not made right, too much matcha which made the drink bitter and waaaay too overpriced- almost $8!

I would stick to basic lattes and coffee here, but of course the art is a nice touch

Really good coffee and descent bakery selections. I live 20mins south of Seattle and fly out to visit friends. This is where I come to get coffee that isn't burnt or bitter, milk never scorched. Blueberry muffins are outstanding. Good stuff.

Perfect little coffee spot in Vegas! I could spend hours here chatting with friends, reading a book or even studying for finals. I don't know why I was unaware of this little coffee spot, but now that I have found it - I don't think I will ever let it go!

I came here on a Sunday morning to get some programming work done.  I am not your foo foo coffee person.  Black house coffee for me.  It was good.  I got a breakfast sandwich.  Basically an Egg Mc Muffin.  $8.00.  A little on the pricey side.

As far as being able to work, it is great.  There are lots of electrical outlets and places you can just sit and set some stuff done.  Free WiFi (with purchase) and it is decent WiFi.

Overall, if you are looking for a place to sit and get some work done this is a good place.

I go to this place almost everyday. Love the people there, love the vibe.
Amazing staff, it feels like home.
I drink espresso and this is one of the best places to get one on this side of the Atlantic. It's strong, full flavored, aromatic it has everything espresso should have.
The ice coffee is to die for in a hot summer day, I didn't know that the ice coffee was this good until I tried Sambalatte's... so much flavor.
Great variety of teas as well and many other coffee drinks, all amazing.
If you have some work to do you can always hook to the free wifi. There's a huge table for laptops with power plugs so you can work and enjoy your refreshing or relaxing drink.
Amazing place

Very chill and relaxed. Perfect place to enjoy this beautiful weather. The wait in line was decent and nothing to complain about. The service was wonderful and the atmosphere was nostalgic. The workers were very genuine and truly cared about customer service unlike some businesses in town! They definitely know what accountability and integrity is all about. Keep it up with your honest customer service!
I like this place, ritzy. A friend invited me here and I find myself just hanging out pretty often when I have free time, great environment, staff is nice, relaxing.

Had a really good flat white here! It's hard to find a shop that serves that drink so I was excited. They had amazing pastries as well. Friendly people behind the counter. 

Only downside is the cliche "coffee shop decor" like pictures of coffee beans which isn't in my taste but to each his own.

After a prolong absence from Sambalatte, today's visit did not make my heart grow fonder. Even on a warm day in a beautifully decorated coffee shop, it felt ice cold. There was no welcoming greet, not even a smile or a smirk from any of the staff. My feeling was confirmed when the girl took my order and I asked her what item would she recommend. In a way, I thought it was a way to strike up a small conversation or some type of pleasantry. Quite the opposite- blankly she responded "its whatever you want". Thanks for the help. Whats worse, my $6 mocha latte w/the hand crafted foam on top (really what you pay for) was not to-go as I had asked- she ended up pouring it into a paper cup ...Now it just tastes like my kids chocolate milk with a little caffeine.

You can find me at Sambalatte every morning....when I need a pick me up! The vibe is awesome, especially at nights when they sometime have live entertainment!! My only complaint is the parking of Bocca Park....talk about a mad house!! Overall, Sambalatte is absolutely fabulous, and the baristas are top notch!

Such a cute little coffee shop! I ordered a matcha latte and I was so surprised that it was so perfect. They don't over sweeten like "other" shops do. They have a large variety of treats to eat too! I am super strong with my eating but they even had paleo options for me to choose from for a snack. There also was live music! Such great vibes here, I am happy I found it while traveling through he area.

Nestled in the shopping and dining extravaganza of Boca Park (which borders Summerlin, for you non-Westsiders) lies the delectably comfortable atmosphere of Sambalatte Torrefazione.

Sambalatte is no Starbucks. Walking up to it, one notices the outside patio rivals the entire interior of competitors, and walking inside, it only gets larger. Yet while some might associate an oversized anything to be of Walmart quality, Sambalatte is certainly not, both in decor and atmosphere, nor in quality and taste, as one would expect.  And of course not in price.

Although many of the high-end locations inside the cosmopolitan complex of Boca Park are of a similarly high-end price, which one would expect, Sambalatte's prices are quite fair given what it offers. Take for example the hot mocha latte adorned with some of the coolest "coffee art" I've ever seen, which runs at $4.10, tastes superb and will add a strong jolt to those of us needing some extra energy. To-go cups and containers are also available for all drinks, but if you're in the area it's best to take a break and relax.

A quick coffee craving can easily be changed into an enjoyable and relaxing afternoon out too. Bookcases and newsstands are set up around the location, full of plenty of interesting magazines and even plenty of novels. Heading upstairs leads to even more bookcases, and a feel of some sort of private, extravagant library, which is all at one's disposal. Alone in a corner next to a big-screen TV are board games like Monopoly and Pictionary.

Aside from a wide range of coffee offerings (which can also be made in special styles such as the aero press, French press and so on) are plenty of teas and other specialty and seasonal drinks to satisfy just about any thirst, and a plethora of decadent pastries and delicious sandwiches.

While I generally end up at Sambalatte for early hour or mid-afternoon study sessions, if you visit in the evening you might get lucky enough to catch some live music, which, in the past has managed not to be too invasive but perfectly enjoyable.

Despite the ability to accommodate several dozen coffee connoisseurs, on early weekend mornings Sambalatte can still manage to pack up quite a bit, but one can almost surely find a spot to sit down and enjoy the experience -- and if not, well, Lee's is around the corner for an early night start.

Originally written for an published in the Rebel Yell (http://www.unlvrebelyell.com/2012/04/19/sambalatte-deserves-some-attention/)

Ahhh Sambalatte where do I begin...

This place is great if you enjoy a cliche vegas place trying too hard to be something it is not, trendy/local/hip... Its completely kitsch

Their subpar coffee is prepared by uneducated (coffee-wise) and rude employees their latte art is cool but it adds to the already long wait to get some coffee. 
 #gag

There are a few things I look for in a coffee shop: coffee quality, atmosphere, and wifi. Sambalatte does all three pretty well.

As far as coffee, I got the Guatemala pour-over. The quality was great. They have some other options, too--Ethiopia Sidoma included. My friend got the cold brew which was also excellent. They serve the cold brew in bottles you can pour yourself. This was cool for us because we could buy some bottles to take with us. They have your standard espresso-based options, and a good selection of sandwiches and pastries, too.

I liked the atmosphere, too. Friendly staff. There are two levels, plenty of tables, seats, and counters, and the kicker: they actually place outlets almost everywhere if you want to plug your laptop in. The place has a wall with a giant map painted on of the countries where they get their coffee from.

And finally, the wifi. A decent amount of coffee places don't have wifi functional enough to do work. Sambalatte's wifi worked really well, and they print the wifi network and password on the receipt so it's there for you to access, which I thought was a nice touch.

We ducked into Sambalatte on a stop in Vegas during a two-week road trip across the U.S. One of the best we've come across so far.

Sambalatte is everything you dream about in a coffee shop. From two story seating areas to the urban design to the great drinks and food, this place is it! 

The coffee made here is quality brewed and made to perfection. The rainbow latte is an extra special drink for days that you feel happy and colorful:) It is a latte with a rainbow design and it's super cute! Their other hot drinks are also delicious, especially if you add some whip cream to it.

Their food choices always lures me in. It literally has all the best bakery options. Their ham and cheese croissant is one of my favorites with extra rich flavor and flakey texture. A popular one is the almond croissant which is perfect for days that you can't decide if you want sweet or savory. Their macarons...these little devils are what is causing my sweet tooth. They have so many options for flavors and the texture is perfect!
Good ambience. The coffee is overpriced. The quality is not that great compared to its price. The chocolate muse was not fresh, not well made and it was 7.50$. Better try dessert in other place.
great coffee, great tunes, great people. I just wish there were times when the environment was more conducive to working/studying.

Sambalatte is a great place for coffee lovers.  The menu offers a variety of different blends and flavors so coffee drinkers will nerver get caught saying "I'll have the usual." 

At first glance it seems like a place to sit down and chat for a few hours, which it is, but don't overlook getting a cup to go.  The location offers a number of stores.  Getting a cup of hand brewed coffe and strolling through shops makes for a wonderful relaxing afternoon.

We were in Las Vegas, had just finished a mountain bike ride at Cottonwood Canyon and asked the bike shop where we rented our bikes for a recommendation for a coffee shop. We are coffee snobs, living in the Bay Area, we try local (non chainstore) roasters up and down from the Ctiy to San Jose where we live. There are hundreds of independent roasters and we try to hit them all. 

What luck that Las Vegas Cyclery knows their coffee. We ate lunch there and everything on the menu look sumptuous. We had the chicken salad sandwich and a very generous and reasonably priced fruit salad. Staying on the strip, and after spending 3 hours in the desert on a bike, this place felt like home. Clean, lots of choices of food, coffee and tea, we were in heaven. Had a blueberry muffin for dessert that was as fresh and delicious as our favorite bakeries at home. We stayed 2 hours, reluctant to drive back to the strip.

I recently moved to Las Vegas from Seattle and picked up an addiction to coffee. I was hopeful about Sambalatte as it looks like a legit coffee house from it's appearance. 

I walked up to the counter and the barista was talking to her co-worker for several minutes before she even acknowledged me. Strike one. I ordered a caramel iced latte with 3 shots and she said they couldn't do that because their machine made either 2 or 4 shots. Uh...ok. You can't pull two shots and then a single one from an espresso machine? Strike two. I sat down at the only space available and the guitar player who must have been performing there that afternoon showed up and never said anything, but looked like he wanted to set up in our spot and kept sighing and looking at his watch. Strike three. I wolfed down my not-so-spectacular quad shot latte and muffin and couldn't get out of there fast enough. 

The only good thing I can say about my experience is that the cranberry muffin I had was top notch and delicious. Too bad about the coffee and the rude staff.

The search continues....
Great tasting coffee, huge muffins and wifi. What else can you ask for?  But don't worry,  they have more than just muffins.

Fell in love when I stepped into this beautiful establishment. I love how cozy it feels and how it's stepping into a hipster hub. People on their laptops, people having conversations, people studying...heck, people can even people watch from the second floor or watch a game on TV. I remember trying the Nutella latte. It was hugeeee! It was too sweet for my taste, but I enjoyed as much as I could regardless because the aesthetics of the place made me feel happy.

Love love love Sambalatte. I'm not a Starbucks kinda girl, I like the cozy coffee shops with character that I can't get anywhere else. Obsessed with their Red Rock Latte, staff is awesome (Manager Alex is so friendly and hospitable, Barista Ale is a gem), I could go on and on but the point is check it out- You'll be glad you did.

Yum. This place was awesome. First off... I love the selection of Macarons. I think there were like a dozen. And they melt in your mouth. My frozen Vanilla coffee drink was fantastic and didn't wire me up too much. The place is practically designed for college students in need of a great place to study. There were outlets EVERYWHERE. There's even a second level that I will explore next time. The service was fast, friendly, and helpful when I had stupid questions. I will definitely be back to sample more awesomeness.

The creations they make are very unique and everything tastes great. You can tell they put time into their food and coffee alike. Local artists come and perform here too so if you want some variety and entertainment its on hand at this place. However the reason I'm giving this place three stars is because of how cramped it feels inside. I feel like if it was a bigger place with maybe more couches and comfort chairs it would be a great place to just chill and relax. When it's busy especially it feels like you have to squeeze through everything, and then the table you sit at is this tiny little table that can barely hold two plates. Even though to be honest the place fits itself, maybe they can open another larger location with more comfortable dining and relaxed atmosphere. Also, it seems like a lot of people come here just to be with the "in" crowd, as it is a hot place right now. So just know it's a crowded place most the time and a bit noisy.

More expensive than Starbucks? Yes. Better coffee?? Definitely. Every time I come here I get the Nutella latte & while it's over $5 & only comes in one size, I'll keep coming back. 

I think if I ever started a book club or a movie club, this is where we'd have our weekly meetings. Lol
I just love this place and  i have been here countless times.

So coffee, tea, delicious pastries, and an awesome ambiance walk into a bar........

If there is a heaven, and they have a coffee shop, this is its earth location, here's why:

Magazines, books, and board games, plenty of seating (although it does get crowded), wifi, communal tables, live music, eclectic collection of teas and a variety of intriguing coffees, delicious pastries (macarons!!) informed and warm staff, outside seating, intelligent and carefully chosen decor.  


This is a great place to reconnect with your inner-renaissance movement.  

Rediscover your love of literature, music, new aromas, tastes, and good people.  If this review sounds too good to be true, it's only because you haven't been here yet.
Pretty nice spot! A Lil snug for me in means of space.

Sambalatte's is a beautiful place. However, almost $6 for a small cup of latte is ridiculous! Yes, I get it, we're paying for your overhead and gorgeous designs, but that's not our responsibility. I'd rather pay less at a place where we don't have to help pay for the decor, etc., and there are many places like that with great tasting coffee. Also, the service wasn't that great and they were a bit snooty with no smiles or friendliness. Anyway, I won't be back to finance your cafe.

I can't belive that till now I haven't left my 5 stars for this place , this is a one of a kind coffee shop with style, there is a live music some evenings and a dj sometimes , love the white mocha and the Tiramisu cup desert. This place is not only about coffee it's also about ambiance and hanging in. Honestly one of the best coffee shop in Vegas. Love you Samballate thanks for making me to feel back in europe:)
Great spot to grab something sweet and sip cappuccino after dinner! The live music is so relaxing! Sip, Savour, Socialize
A great place for morning coffee.  The service is good , but don't expect your order fast.  They take their time making a really good coffee or espresso.  Sunday has live music.

this is like syrup desserts in L.A. but better. and intelligenista without the hipster boys in skinny jeans making the coffee. nestled in a nice plaza with ample  PARKING!!!!!! i had needed a place to do some studying before going to electric daisy carnival.  and needed a change of scenery from starbucks. so let me list the things i've had...

espresso - strong/good
nutella latte - OK (thank you for my mickey mouse inspired foam design)
regular latte - good
s'more cupcake - a little on the chewy side, but good
creampuff - stale
croissant - good
wifi - good
