i loved the setting. so many different people there from students, to people lounging/socializing, and many many "meetings."  las vegas, you are so productive.  i'm so glad you all aren't so overpowered by apple products and a majority of you are not hipster-looking. the only downside is that this place does fill up, and yes, a little bit on the expensive side. 

did you know they filmed part of that documentary "gigolos" here?! hahahahahahaha. ha.

One of my favorite places to sit, people-watch, read or get some work done. Everyone always raves about the coffee, but its teas and hot cocoas deserve just as much praise. 

It's also a great place for breakfast - I've sampled (read: devoured) all of their croissant sandwiches and quiche and can attest that they rival anything from Einstein's or Panera. 

For lunchtime, unfortunately, the soups are pretty bland; they're vegetarian and broth-based, so they lack that savoriness. 

The only other negative comment I can make is to warn others who might go to get some work done that there's acoustic performances in the evenings (starting around 7 or sometimes earlier, depending on the day) and if you want a quiet place, this won't be it. The singers are always LOUD, though a few are quite talented.

I love the vibe of this place. It's super relaxing with a literally library upstairs with seating. The decor is awesome and the employees have been friendly every time I've visited. But recently my (simple) order have been getting messed up. Whether it be forgetting things, changing me wrong, or just the item/drink not being right overall. I'll let the other times slide but recently I just ordered a simple tea. Nothing fancy. I'm not sure if it was how the tea bag was handled or maybe I just got a faulty bag but it completely burst open inside my cup and I didn't know until I took a sip and got a mouthful of tea leaves. It wasn't hot either. Just warm. 

I like this place. I really do. But I probably won't order anything from here again at least for awhile. I won't steer anyone away from it but just keep an eye out on your orders! :)
Got a credit from the hotel so we tried it. Food and drinks are overpriced, as expected. Both of them taste pretty good though.

As an employee, it may be found inappropriate to write a review here. But perhaps, being on the inside of the business provides a different perspective than that of the customer. So, with that being said, here is my unbiased opinion of the company and the product. Sambalatte is run by Luiz Oliveira, an experienced businessman from the heart of Rio de Janeiro. With nearly 30 years of experience, you can expect top of the line service, and he does not disappoint. What I've learned that I didn't know before I was employed was that the food was baked and made each morning from a local cook using organic ingredients. I also learned that the beans come from all over the world by LOCAL growers. The Monte Carlo location roasts the beans as well. So, although customers come in and find that the food and drinks may be unusual, it is without said that whatever price you pay, you should expect love in each and every sip or bite. The atmosphere is incredible and the people that come in are very interesting, and as an employee, I'm excited to start my day at this place. If you're a coffee connoisseur, you're missing out by not coming here. If you're a simple customer curious or debating whether to come, you're missing out if you don't. I'm grateful to be with this company.

Coolest place EVER. not only for the cappuccino (which, in my opinion, is the best in town, hands down), but for the vibe and PEOPLE. The staff dresses up for Halloween, they know me by name, they have AMAZING musicians performing constantly, and it's a great place to network! I actually get MORE work done at Sambalatte than I do at my office on certain days. Love it!!
Credit when credit is due.  This place is good.  The baristas have it right.  Kudos to a job well done.  And you'll do yourself a favor by coming here for a cappuccino.

I have only made a couple of visits here thus far, but every time, it's outstanding.  Delicious coffee drinks, cold or hot and they seem to take everything into account and invest heavily in "doing it right".  The array of pastries looks amazing, but I have yet to indulge.  Nice relaxed atmosphere, great service and top notch flavors!

This is such a cute little coffee shop! The staff is friendly and welcomes you the moment you come in. This is a nice place to study if you like the busy cafe feel; but if you need a more quiet area to study, maybe grab a snack and coffee here and find somewhere else to study.

My favorite here is the nutella latte, it is just amazing! You can tell that the coffee is freshly ground and it is smooth and flavorful, while the hint of chocolate and hazelnut enhances the coffee, making a slightly sweet and nutty flavor to the overall drink. In addition, they even make their lattes look pretty with designs on top using the steamed milk. 

They also have a wide selection of desserts and snacks; from warm and light quiches to macarons and cakes. I haven't tried much of their food (except their quiches, which are delicious), but their coffee is amazing.

Will be coming back!

I am in LOVE with this place!!!  It's intimate and the beverages are all made with care and craft.  It does take a bit of a wait but it is so worth it.  The hours are also "normal", unlike Starbucks but the vibe of the place is contemporary and fun.  What is also great about this place is the secure internet usage.  Unlike Starbucks, where you have access to the internet, it is not secure.  Here, they provide you a password on a daily basis to log-in and it is secure.  So you can do what ever you need on the internet and know everything you do on it is secure.  I also had a chance to have some of their bake goods and it is delish!  It is made on property and fresh!

First off how do they have so many great reviews??? Chai tea out of a box!!!!! If I wanted Starbucks I would have gone there... Not to mention it was luke warm... Gross. Customer service needs help.. First and last time here!!!

Great place to meet up. Nicely decorated and inviting. Unfortunately, I gave 3 stars for the coffee. I would rather frequent a cafe' that puts more emphasis on their beans and coffee. My cappuccino was mediocre at best.  They didn't offer a choice for the beans and just used a 'blend' for espressos.

Awesome place.  We don't have too much cafe like this in Vegas.   Coffee is so good, and the staff is very nice.  I love there is a live music too.  
I hope there would be more seats especially outside since everytime when I stop by with my dog, it is impossible to find a seat, so I had to go somewhere else unfortunately.  It's getting so popular, so I wish they would open another store.

Great coffee but the service is not always the best. Especially when it's an hour before closing when all they want to do is leave. At least that's the way it seems. These locations don't stay open very late at all as a matter of fact they close kinda early. If your looking for a coffee shop to hang out at later in the evening you might have to loo

Service is always on point here and the atmosphere is amazing. Their teas and coffees are made with the upmost care and passion. Their pastries are pretty amazing as well! The apple tart had the perfect amount of sweetness in the compote and apple coupled with the delicious buttery taste of the pastry. Yum. My only complaint is the temperature in the space always seems to be off: They leave the door open on chilly days most times I am there making me not want to lounge about and stay longer but that aside this is the best coffee house in west las vegas.
A welcome relief from the big name coffee spots. There are often local musicians performing adding a community texture that is sorely missing in our city.

Gibraltar Review

The Pour:
Very good, roast is nice and medium, forgot to ask what they had on bar but I think their general profile is on the medium side

Service:
Baristas are all skilled at pulling the shot and the latte art - quite friendly too.

Ambiance:
Not particularly hipster, average coffeeshop vibe. Clean and moderately busy the times I went there.

Conclusion:
Very good, my favorite by far of what I tried in Las Vegas, although I only tried out a few places while I was visiting.

About Me / Review Criteria:
-I only review "Third Wave"/artisanal/craft coffee shops (whatever you want to call them)
-Nobody gets more than 4 stars until I've gone several times
-Reviews can't be based on just a select group of baristas, they all have to be equally skilled, or at least must all have a minimum level of skill
-My star ratings are solely based on the drink, never on food, ambiance, or if the barista is emo or snobby (because that would bring down more than 50% of the shops), although I do mention those in the review
-I don't claim to be a trained coffee connoisseur
-My reviews are generally based on gibraltar/cortados (or cappuccinos), not espresso or drip/pourover coffee

Hand pour Sumatra black...hands down this is the best cup of coffee I have had in Las Vegas. I have never ordered anything other than this item. 

Not sure what else to say about the place other than it's the best coffee that I have had in Vegas. I have not purchased snacks or food items from here but I did notice they have a lot of vegan options. 

Solid 5 stars. Great service. Nice location. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. 

I live nowhere near Sambalatte but I hop in my car and drive there just to get a cup of Sumatra! I probably just need to buy a bag of these beans and keep them on hand :)
Super yummy chai latte! They make it look tasty too:) I would definitely go back! Very cute coffee shop.
Love this coffee shop!!! Great service never have been disappointed! My never favorite place to hang out with friends and drink a awesome cup of coffee!!

Came here on a cloudy, thursday early afternoon. To my surprise, it was completely packed ! !  People everywhere, in almost every seat, and the line had at least 5-8 people. Ordering process was quick. 

I had ordered a latte, to be drank there, extra hot. My drank came out pretty fast. Maybe around 3 minutes. 

Since there was no seats, i opt'ed to sit outside. Even though it was a little chilly. Thought my "extra hot" latte would hold me off for a while. When i had drank my latte, it was... maybe warm. I didn't wanna bring it back in because the drink was pretty full and it was quite the far walk with such a full drink. xD The flavor of their latte is pretty strong. In comparison to a matcha latte i had at their other location on jones, this was MUCH stronger. The matcha latte, I didnt really taste much of the matcha. It was nice that i got my drink so fast, but maybe they missed the "extra hot" part of the order. 

I've been here a few times, on separate occassions (work, social, or reading). The atmosphere is pretty good. The last time i was at this location, there was a live performance by a local artist. It was kind of loud, especially if you were there to socialize with friends. 

This location has an upper floor. A few individual/2 seaters, and one long table that seats i believe 6-8. Good place for a coffee or a snack, located in Boca Park, next to other restaurants. Parking may be a little pain, depending on the time you go there. Overall, nice place for a good cup of coffee, that's not starbucks :P

i always come back here for the macarons, flew here straight from France, love the pistachio and grape/currant flavors.  The ice cappucinno here always cool down a hot day plus give me a boost into the evening, what i like here is that they have a bottle of agave nectar ready to sweeten the ice drinks nicely.  I can never understand how crystalize sugar would work in a cold drink.

The lattes are ok except for two things...first, they are painfully slow in fixing your latte and second, they serve them luke warm at best. This after requesting to please make it "stupid, crazy, circus hot" and doubling down by emphasizing how important temperature is to me.

My latte came out, eventually, and was cold in 5 minutes. With all the choices out there, and closeby, one would think they would want to keep their customers happy. 

Go to Desert Wind Coffee Roasters a couple miles away and enjoy a really good, HOT latte made just the way you like it.

Stopped by here with the Yelp-izzles after dinner for some coffee and tea. LiLy D, Anthony M, and Jieun L got coffee. I got the Vanilla Roobios tea. It was yummy! Thanks LiLy!!

We sat in the front area and noticed a bunch of board/card games. LiLy saw Scrabble and had to play. Congrats to Jieun for scoring the most points and kicking our butts...and it was her first time playing!!

I will mos def come back and try some of the other teas and some gelato!

Matt C also made an appearance and had some coffee with us.

This place is great to hang out. The staff were all friendly and they have a row of tables where you can set up your laptops. FREE Wi-Fi
This place is so cute and so big! I love the coffee but the muffins are okay, nothing to scream about to be honest.

Wow!! Now that's what I call coffee!!! I am simply blown away by this place. All of the coffee here is exceptional, but the one I always order is a regular latte. This is not your Starbucks latte. The flavor of it is just world-class. It's so complex, with nutty, caramel undertones, without being bitter. It is well prepared and executed. Haven't tried any of the pastries or savory foods, but it all looks spectacular. Sometimes they have live music here as well. The setup of the lounging areas is totally fung shui, whether it is downstairs or upstairs. The outside has a nice little setup as well. You just feel real comfortable at this place. Highly recommend, and this is the place I take out of town-ers or visitors.

Love it. 

Cute coffee shop very European. 

Cool patio lil Bit overpriced pastries but Good quality. 

Will come back asap

Nutella latte and white chocolate mocha are killer. Also one of the best chai lattes I've had. A little long wait for food but over all I love this place. The patio is great and lattes are even better.

Can I give it zero stars??? Overpriced and service is horrible! I dont mind paying more many for the coffee but when it is served with attitude ... No thank you. I will better go to Tivoli village next door. Leone caffe has best coffee in town and service is sooooo friendly. Good bye samba latte. Never coming back!

For the life of me I can never understand how this place survives with their mediocre coffee and service. I'm forced to do meetings in this location because it's in Boca Park and centrally located, otherwise this place is not a place to rely on for a good coffee fix.

I've had everything from their cappuccinos, specialty Nutella coffees, lattes iced and cold, regular coffee and it's totally served the same...forgettable.. Get ready to drown your coffee with milk (containers are usually empty) or pack it with sugar (if there's any around) because I guarantee you that after a couple times spending $6.00 or more for coffee you'll end up just ordering hot coffee and going through the motions that you're actually drinking it.

Now if you're eating or meeting here in the winter time, be prepared to bring a jacket and scarf because this place has one of the most annoying swinging doors in Vegas. You know the kind when a customer comes in the cold air blasts through and the door doesn't automatically close? Yeah it's that place. Be prepared to freeze.

The only upside to this place is the cool library vibe inside and the outdoor patio. Very good people watching but you'll pay the price nursing a bad cup of coffee.
Warm and inviting space. Great for studying or a conversation date. The latte is solid.

Diverse coffee and espresso selection. Prices were competitive especially when considering that you get a fun foam design with your latte that adds to the experience. The environment was amazing, I loved how I felt like I was on vacation while reading out on their beautiful patio. The feel is hipster yet inviting. Great staff. Dogs are welcome. Head upstairs and check it out.

Coffee is only slightly better than Starbucks but the atmosphere is great!

-Make sure to tell them the coffee drink size and your choice of milk-yes at more experienced coffee houses they will ask you but not here...

-Pros: beautiful interior and good coffee and sandwiches
-Cons: overcrowded and usually no place to sit inside, very expensive pastries and coffee.  Bland desserts!

Best latte I have ever had so I keep coming back here, but the customer service always makes me feel like I do not belong there! Their is an air about the place that they just know I typically frequent Starbucks- and they make me feel ashamed for doing so!!

While the place is expensive and I almost dread coming in for fear I will not fit in and the judgmental stares from the barista- I keep coming back because the lattes are to die for!

A bit overrated, and even though they have good coffee, it's too pricey.
Almost $10 for a small premade breakfast sandwich and pastries prices are really high too. 
I like the variety of coffee and the quality for coffee.

So this review is based off the recent Gilmore Girls event. I was debating on leaving this review but as a company, they should have been more prepared for such a large gathering where they could have gained NEW customers. Especially when their location was picked to be shown on the news! They didn't take the event seriously and barely used the Netflix marketing they had. After waiting 1.5 hours I decided I didn't want the "free" Coffee especially after finding out that only the first 250 people (which I was probably 300th or so in line) just received a code for 3 months of Netflix free so to make my time more worth the wait I bought myself a Lavender Latte. Another 30 minutes later I finally got my latte and sure it was pretty with the little latte heart but it tasted horrible and nothing like coffee or lavender!! What a waste of 2 hours just for a paper cup with a Gilmore Girls quote. All the staff members looked tired and miserable and come on, you should have been more prepared! Just one of the managers was busting his ass off to make everyone happy and he's the only reason I'm even leaving 2 stars because at least he tried unlike the rest of his staff. Although they really should have had 2 cashiers, 2 coffee/food runners, and 1-2 people making the specialty coffee/drinks as opposed to 1 of each. I won't be back to this location but I will consider their location on Jones as when I went there in the past the coffee was perfect and even though it was busy their customer service was on point.

The ambiance is just about the only good thing I can say for this establishment. When coming here at their opening for a promotional deal, free coffee and pastries, we asked what coffee was free (because sometimes only certain items are free off the menu) and got told, very obnoxiously by our cashier, "Yes, Latte is a coffee." Without any explanation or context.   

The staff seem apathetic and disgruntled, although whether the issue is with each other or the customers is unclear. My coffee was sitting out for five minutes because my name must have been whispered from the kitchen for how loud they called it. While our order was for here, one of the drinks was in a paper to-go cup, without a lid or a drink holder. 

Whenever I come here I tend to assume any drink I order will be criminally under-sweetened, and today was no exception. The lavender white mocha tastes like nothing at all, except a mild sprinkling of tasteless foam. I usually need four raw sugars, or more, to combat the bland, lifeless coffee.

We go here every Sunday. Great atmosphere. I love the live music. Great coffee. Starbucks ain't got nothing in these baristas seriously! They are like coffee and espresso experts here. Huge cups of coffee too and a great price. I love their fancy little macaroons. Friendly staff. I love coming here because of the coffee #1 but also because of how cool looking it is. Looks like the typical coffee shops you see on the movies where people go to chill.

Being very particular about my coffee, I can share with you that this is the best place to have a cappuccino or any kind of cup of coffee in Las Vegas. The baristas are very well trained in delivering the best coffee possible, not to mention extremely friendly. A must visit if you are in Las Vegas or you reside in the west side of town.

Best Coffee is Vegas hands down. Everything from the baristas to the manager to the ambiance. The outdoor seating is prefect for late evening before of after dinner drinks. A great place to have a coffee date or drink solo. If you're ever undecided what to drink let the barista know what you're in the mood for and they will definitely deliver.

I really really wanted to love this place. Especially after all the reviews. However my experiences here have for the most part been met with pretty poor service. The coffee is pretty good though. Today 03/05/14 I stopped in with my mom and girlfriend. My girlfriend can't have gluten and we saw the flour less dairy free chocolate chip cookies. We asked the girl on register(young,very petite Asian girl) if since it says flour less would that also be gluten free. She said it's dairy free. We said we want to know if it's gluten free and she says she thinks so but isn't sure. If you sell it I believe you should know what is in your products. I told her never mind because she didn't even offer to ask anyone else. I ordered a white mocha cappuccino and she says they only make Nutella and regular and that they can't make white mocha a cappucino. Basically what I waned waswhite mocha with extra extra foam. She seemed uniformed. I may give them another chance in the future but I don't know how many more times I'll spend my money on bad service even for above par coffee.

I used to enjoy this place. I wouldn't go very often, just enough to satisfy the urge to have 'authentic' coffee that is so hard to come by in this city. I frequent Starbucks, so I'm horribly accustomed to that 'corporate' taste. Starbucks coffee isn't bad, by any means. However in comparing it to places like sambalatte, in the past, Starbucks would be the equivalent to an assembly line where as sambalatte would be the small business that personalizes each service they provide. And you used to be able to taste this distinction. 

However, these last couple of time I've been there, this places taste quality has fallen dramatically. What is the point of a 'cool' scene to hang out at if the product you're paying for is highly over priced for extremely tiny sizes without the unique taste that would normally be enough to balance out the size and price?

This last time my boyfriend went there, he ordered a white mocha and a nutella. He brought them home and they both tasted like lattes. Literally could NOT distinguish between the two save for a slight sliver of a sweeter taste on one of them. They didn't just taste like plain lattes, they tasted like lattes you could make on a keurig machine. We paid 12$ for keurig coffee. 

A bit of advice, work less on your latte 'art' and more on the actual taste of your product. The sweets and pastries are pretty good. But this place is called sambalatte. Not sambapastry.

I wish this place was right around the corner from my house. I would visit daily. But it is in Summerlin in the Las Vegas metropolitan area. So I will go only when I am in Vegas. But I look forward to my next visit. The most important element of this unique coffeehouse is the exquisite care they take to prepare the perfect coffee product, whether it is a cup of Joe or a latte or other trendier drink. I had a fantastic cup of coffee that was drip brewed at the a perfect 205 degree. The coffee choices made it tough to choose one. I picked the Farenza Cianorte which was a coffee that I had not tried before. It was sweet and rich, but also with a citrus tone that made it a perfect mid morning coffee. The Missus had a perfectly made cappuccino that if we had had more time I would have tried as well. The pastries (both savory and sweet) made it tough to choose.The tea selection also looked interesting. The place itself is a very attractive space. All and all, a uniquely special caffeination spot.

If your looking for any quaint coffee shops in Vegas, this is the closest... The only thing that makes it not feel so quaint is that it's in a shopping center. But anything beats being away from the strip and all the mess. I got an americano which was really smooth. Another day I did get the drip which was a very weak for my taste and pricey at approx $3.49 for a 12oz. All the pastries look amazing but I chose a vegee croissant. It was decent, At 8$ a bit overpriced for the taste.... The shop itself has a hipster feel and look which is cool. :) love all the burlap bags and the bike outside that creates a great ambiance. I would go back for another americano and maybe try a yummy looking muffin. :)

Seriously the WORST DRINK I've gotten. I always order the same drink and this time they messed it up so bad!!!!! I order a Tahitian vanilla freppe with Carmel and today I got milk blended with ice. This literally tastes like NOTHING. Super annoyed and this isn't a cheap coffee. Waisted time coming down here and wasted my money.

Wanna hang out with your girlfriends or have meetings with clients!  This is the place!  
Interior feels so comfortable and better yet with a perfect soy latte, delicious.  
A great local coffee shop!
I enjoy it every time I go to Sambalatte!

I love this place and it blends in so beautifully with the shopping center. I feel like I am in a small city in Europe or something when I am in this shopping center. 

This place is packed with chatty people and friendly baristas. I read previous reviews and some yelped mentioned about the high price. Well, I think people come here to relax and have a conversation with friends while drinking high quality customized coffee. So, I think the price is reasonable. 

A perfect place to hang out with your friends or a nice spot to enjoy your lazy morning with a cup of coffee.

Relaxed and chill coffeehouse with a laid-back atmosphere and cool patio, decadent pastry case full of desserts, and high-quality coffee, all served up by genuine and friendly staff! What more could you ask for?

Vaguely reminiscent of Blue Bottle in SF, this place has the 90s coffeehouse  setting down pat. Menu has a lot of dessert-coffee drinks available along with high quality regular stuff. Opted for the chocolate cappuccino and the matcha latte, and asked the cashier what her favorite dessert was- I was eyeing the tiramisu or brownie parfaits. She gave me a look that said, "No way, Jose!" and immediately let me know that her favorites are the nutella or crunch bombs- but admitted she was a huge chocoholic.

Opted for the nutella bomb, a chocolate-covered dome with an accent chocolate on top, to accompany our drinks- all were out quickly. Chocolate capp was delicious, but not the best I've had in LV. Matcha latte was a unique drink, and I appreciated that it was not caffeinated and not too sweet, but did not feel it was worth the $6.25 price.

But the nutella bomb. Shut the front door.
I can't even describe it, but it was amazing. A chocolate-covered dome of white fluffy stuff and what seemed to be bits of chocolate cake, all on top of a thick, crunchy cookie-type wafer. It was heaven. So glad I split the order too- it appeared small but was very indulgent and probably a meal's worth of calories.
But I'd get it again.

This place is almost always crowded. Whenever I go to coffeeshops I like it cozy and when I've come here lately, it's been crowded and it's hard to find a place to sit down. 

I find coffee shops my third place environment, somewhere away from home and workplace, some place I can sit down and clear my thoughts and to study (expect tables to be extremely small and 1 table won't fit a laptop & books)

The place is crowded and kinda small. 

ALSO the food is totally overpriced and it's not that great. Whenever I go to samba I usually go to Grimaldi's or Wahoo's for food because the food isn't that great. I've tried a couple of the sandwiches and the lentil soup which are just mediocre, nothing special but the prices are like 9+ and their quiches are about $7-8 and they're just OK. 

Their macarons aren't the best in town and I recommend going to patisserie manon for macarons AND quiches. (patisserie manon is literally 2 min away) Quiches are FIVE dollars at patisserie and they are actually good, since that place IS a french bakery so they make it there fresh daily. 

SO for food --MEH and the crowdedness, 3 stars because they do have really good drip coffee. 

Their lattes are overpriced and they are pretty good because of the quality and freshness of the espresso. 

About a year ago, I would have given this place 5 stars. It was my "go to" when I wanted to kick back at a coffee shop. But now that everyone knows of this place, it is just too congested.

Ick- wanted to like this place, service was okay, the Honduras was good, not great, but the mocha frappe (I think it's called that?!) was TERRIBLE! Watered down chocolate shake, NOT worth $5.50...McDonald's frappe is better! And I'm being nice :/
Maybe I'm spoiled with independent coffee houses back home, but this place blew! Back to L.A. County and yummy coffee!
A new take on coffee experience, nothing like starbucks or the typical American coffee houses. So far the drinks ive had are good, strong and enjoy the essence of coffee.

It was my first time here after a friend recommended it to me. I would have gave it a five star but my order came in later after the orders of people who were behind me got theirs first. But I ordered the matcha latte and it was excellent. I would come again to try all of their lattes!!!

The place is really nice. Small but nice. A lot people are here on there computer. Haven't tried any of the pastry or foods. It's my first time here and usually I always ask for sweet drinks cashier recommended the berry tea it was good actually.

The place is cute and has a nice feel to it. Good place to study at. Has 2 floors, a smaller upper level with seating, shelves of books and games hidden in the cabinets. Can get busy from what I've seen on my first visit. I ordered the iced Nutella latte. It was pricy 5-6$, and it was ok. I barely tasted nutella, and tasted more milk. Tasted a sandwich on raisin bread and other deliciousness, but I forgot what it was, but the sandwich was good and a healthy one too! Would come back to try other items tho.
Awesome place to do work.  Always a place to sit, even on a crowded Sunday. Eclectic and mellow music. And the coffee/tea is delicious.  I love the iced lavender latte with soy

This is what every coffee shop should strive to be like.  

I asked the cashier if I could get a pourover and was informed that every normal coffee order is a pourover.  What?  That is amazing, and pretty much unheard of in Vegas from what I've seen.  

I got my coffee and chatted with the barista for a few minutes and let me tell you that coffee is perfect.  I've yet to try the espresso drinks but I think I can safely assume they are great too.  

Add in the live music, books, games, and overall cool ambience and it equals a winner.

I'll be honest - it took me awhile to warm up to this place. I didn't really like it at first. But now, after several visits, I consider it a great place to stop by for an occasional treat. 

PROS: This place has a lot of architectural character, there's a nice patio area, and the food and drinks are good. The ambiance is perfect for catching up with friends and I'm particularly impressed with the latte art and the French bakery-quality pastries. 

CONS: The service is very slow - as someone who used to work at Starbucks, I'm always shocked by how disorganized and inefficient the staff are (that kind of thing would never fly at Starbucks), and it certainly doesn't help that the place is packed on evenings and weekends. Also, the wannabe-hipster vibe can get annoying...I think that was the biggest initial turn off for me (although I've since learned to ignore it).   

Bottom Line: It's a nice little cafe, but it has its flaws. If I have the extra time and can go during non-peak hours, I like to treat myself to Sambalatte. Otherwise, Starbucks is just a lot easier.

This location is a hit or miss for me. While I enjoy meeting my friends here and cruising on free wifi, it can get so packed(including parking). Drinks are sometimes great, other times too watered down for me. I don't suggest the iced teas, but I do suggest their lattes.
For the most part, its a nice place to drop by if you would like a change of pace from starbucks.

An artisan coffee shop is hard to find in Las Vegas, but that's what Sambalatte is trying to fill. This location in Boca Park is their flagship, has open floor plan and patio seating, and even loft.

The quality of their espresso drinks is on par with the third wave coffee brands in San Francisco - in particular, the signature blend close to Ritual or Sightglass rather than Blue Bottle or Four Barrel.

Sambalatte will continue to be my go to place when I'm in Summerlin and crave a quality cup of coffee.

I come here with friends all the time! They even have water bowls for dogs. Great relaxing place and they have a lot of room compared to other coffee shops. I would recommend coming here to catch up with people, have conversations, or study. They did raise their prices a tad though over the last couple years.

I love love love this place. I go to Vegas often for work, and have been eyeing the reviews for awhile. I finally made a trip there during Thanksgiving and I was in love. Their lattes are amazing. The prices are a bit more than your average coffee shop, but the atmosphere, service and quality make it worth it. I enjoyed a biscotti the first time I went and it was freshly baked and delicious. 

Every time I go to Vegas, I have to go to Sambalatte....even if it is nowhere close to where I am going.

I love the ambiance of this place! Very cozy, nice place to chat with friends or study.. They have a bunch of tables and comfy sofas & free wifi. I tried the black& white coffee? I think that was the name, but it was really good & I love the latte designs. Service is great and the employees are very friendly and helpful. =)

So I dropped my sandwich while trying to get some napkins from the cabinet.  A while later, the cashier saw it and asked me if I would like her to call the owner to see if they can make me another one.  It is my fault for dropping it, but the owner still allowed another one to be made for me.  Not considering the cost of the sandwich, it is very nice of them to make another for me in the end.

I adore this place!!! I can't get enough of their coffee!

The only reason that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is the location. It's too far from my side of town. I live in the Southwest, and they are located in Boca Park.

I have mainly ordered Nutella latte. I LOVE how they do coffee art. The taste for me is just right. I usually sit in the coffee shop and enjoy my coffee, however my friend and I were in a rush for today's visit. 

Today they were pretty crowded. Most of the people who come here are the ones who like to go on their laptops. First floor gets filled up fast, but they do have a second floor. And there's outside seating a well. Even with the crowd and the noise, I still love the whole vibe of the shop.

The service is good and they have a rewards card you can sign up for if you frequent the place. 

I definitely recommend a visit and am repeat customer!

Please sambalatte - open up a location in the Southwest part of town..!!

What took me so long to write a review about this place? I'm ignoring the fact that it took me almost two years for me to even visit Sambalatte (I moved away for a bit).

Now that I am back, I am happy and excited to report that Sambalatte is my favorite place in Las Vegas to hang out, have a non-alcoholic drink and be normal. This is THE best coffee spot! Ever.

The baristas are all VERY knowledgable and can give you advice on their coffees and teas. The service is VERY good and they are efficient.

One example. A visit a little while back, I had an iced tea. I was about to hit the sugar station, and a barista asked if I would like the sugar melted in a little bit of hot water so that it would dissolve in my tea.

It's little things like that. 

Also, they have a nice selection of light bites and some baked goods. 

There are plenty of laptop stations (FREE WIFI) with power outlets. Write your next novel here. Or study. The next time I visit, I plan on coming with a friend to talk about life. Yeah...it's one of those places.

Lastly, there are over 240 reviews for this place. Everything I said....well, has already been said. 

If you are from Vegas or live here, make this a regular spot. Support local when you can. Everyone that works at Sambalatte seems to be a good person in their own genuine way.

Also, if you are from out of town, DRIVE OR TAKE A CAB! PLEASE! This is worth the expense...even if it's not on the strip.

*drops mic
This place has great barista and a good latte and cappuccino. Counter is a bit overwhelming. However coffee and service were grrrrreat!! Should be 4.5!

Way too much hype for this place! And expensive too! I ordered a latte and five macarons.....it costed me $13! The latte I could've gotten better at Starbucks and the macarons had that old refrigerator smell :( I was really disappointed. Everything looked great, but everything tasted below average. Save yourself the money and disappointment

Yay for chill hangout spots and a relaxing scenery. The moment you walk in, it always seems like you're in a cafe where all the cool kids hang out. There's a table on the left side, used for people with laptops. There's also another upstairs with a plug underneath the table (it's kinda hard to know it's there unless someone tells you or you read this). And then there's usually some guitarist playing some amazing music and soothing you with their voice.

The food is pretty up there. Small portion sizes, big taste, high price. Everything they serve edible-wise is all comfort food; don't expect any kind of dinner or buffet of some sort. There's also a wide variety of drinks. I personally got the Nutella (something) coffee. It was alright, didn't taste anything like Nutella though. Was more like harsh coffee than anything. Still, I have yet to try out the whole selection of drinks. 

Another note, to get onto their Wi-Fi, the receipt you get when you purchase something will have the password on the bottom of it. It's like, it could technically be called Paid Wi-Fi, but at the same time, grab someone's receipt and get it from them. No big deal yo.

Good food, drinks galore, and an amazing atmosphere.

Sambalatte is a place that believes it sells top-notch quality coffee and when compared to Starbucks it does! But the jig is up if you've been to coffee houses that actually pull off what they portray themselves as being. 

However, in terms of quality coffee they are not good. Sunrise coffee and Tipsy coffee houses serve better coffee in LV.  They offer pour-over coffee but use a weak ratio giving you a watered down flavor. The cappuccinos are okay. Their espresso is inconsistent. 

Their customer service is not memorable. The people at the counter are ready for your order to be finished and the next person helped. Fast is good, but quality customer service does not make the person ordering feel rushed.

The one quality here is the ambiance and internet. I love the seating both in and outdoors. The location is good. 

Over all, this place could be AWESOME if the owner decides to put time into training the staff to be consistent and did a better job of managing the production.

This is an excellent coffee house. They really care about what the customer wants, and pleasing the taste buds. The coffee is amazing, the bake goods are always mouth watering, and the atmosphere is perfect for socializing, work, or pleasurably reading a book.

I wish I could give it a 4.5.
This time I took my daughter,we ordered for here, and she demanded we check out upstairs. 
She ordered pear tree green tea and was impressed by the presentation,as was I- you get your own individual steeper? Not sure what it's called,see the pic I posted. 
Her tea was delicious,plain or with honey.
Got my usual white mocha,presentation also gorgeous,neat leaf design in huge black cup and saucer. I even held the saucer as I drank,lol!!!
The upstairs is cool-flatscreen,magazines, and a variety of seating.
This place grows on me, especially since I love this damn drink and crave it.

First and foremost, I don't mind spending money on good coffee.  I do have to say that the ambiance has definitely changed quite a bit in the last 6 months.   I used to walk in and see my favorite baristas and we'd chit chat a little but now they all seem to be gone.  I'm going to assume that's because of the new location?  I'm not sure.  Regardless the coffee now seems to taste less satisfying :(.  It's saddening because we really adored this place but now go elsewhere.  If anything it's a testament to the difference people can make in that sort of environment.

Maybe it was just this one really bad experience, but I'm hesitant to say this place is worth the current four stars it has. First of all, the prices for a pastry and latte are super expensive. I get that you're paying for the live music and ambient, but one should only pay so much for a drink. Secondly, the girl who ordered my drink walked away after she accepted my money. Sure enough, my order was not communicated/made, and I had to wait a few extra minutes (seems like forever when you have toddlers with you) after finally getting someone else's attention to ask about my order. If you are going to order something though, be sure to try the lavender latte. It's pretty unique and may be the only reason I give this place another try.

Sambalatte is defnitely the heart of the (Summer)'Lin!  It's a trendy and hip place to hang out.  They've definitely designed the place to be friendly for patrons to hang out because they have laptop friendly tables with outlets and lots of seating inside, outside and in nooks and crannies.

The coffee:
The nutella latte are hot chocolate/chocochino (?) are tasty!

Tip:  Look out on weekends when everyone and their mom is looking to 
join in on the sambalatte fun.

Conclusion:  Hip and trendy coffeehouse good for parking your bum.

My favorite coffee shop in Vegas for the vibe there. Love the live music every time I've been. Sometimes it can get crowded and I've had to wait for seats. Once I had a MILF snap at me in line because I took more than 2 seconds to decide on which macaron I wanted. She didn't even ask and went right in front of me in line as I was admiring the macarons. Pretty normal for some people from this neighborhood I suppose. The macaron was smooth and a tiny bite of perfection. If you don't mind calories this place is great but it does not have as many sugar free options for tea latte or lattes like its competitors.

Chic coffee house that's great for getaways!

This place is ultra cute. It has a little nook area upstairs and its the perfect spot to come for some quiet time or catching up with friends. 

They have a wide selection of drinks, coffee or teas and a lot of beautiful & delicious pastries. Indoor & outdoor seating is available and the little area upstairs is perfect for catching up on some work. Outdoor seating offers great views of Boca Park and is conveniently next to some great boutiques and restaurants.

If you're a fan of Nutella I highly recommend the Nutella latte! The chocolate & hazelnut flavors are captured so well! 

I will be back for the hot stuff once we cool down...

Wow this place is overrated. The employees weren't bad, but not very welcoming either. They were just there and didn't initiate a hello or order. They just look at you until you say something. They have a second floor and patio which is nice to study or meet a friend. But what I really disliked about this place was I bought a brownie and it costs me $7! Seriously?? It was average size and did not even taste good. I assumed it was in the display case for a while. They don't put prices on their pastries for a reason. I also ordered an iced chai latte to-go which was good, but the barista gave it to me overflowing and without a lid?? So when I tried putting a lid on it myself I got it everywhere and had to clean it up. Stick to your local Starbucks.

Large variety of mixed drinks. Food was pre-packaged so I am thinking it's not made fresh at the restaurant. Had the ham and cheese croissant which was okay. Croissant was flat. We also got the bran and carrot muffins- they don't heat them up so if you like hard and cold then that's for you. They had live music on a Sunday morning which is a nice vibe. The mocha was good. Would I travel for this place- no not really. It's more of a neighborhood coffee stop. The drinks are good, food is packaged.

Wow so coming in from LA my sister said let's grab a coffee. Turned up at samba the best the neighborhood has to offer for coffee shops.  Said " great lets go!" Turned up there wer NO tables available and one lady sat at a big table and there where 4 of us   ok well it's a Sunday,, waited for our drinks and when my Nutella latte came out I was SHOCKED at the size of the coffee that cost over $4.00! It was tiny! I asked what size is this ? She replied umm the size we do out cappuccinos & lattes. It was close to the size of a espresso cup! Such a rip off! And the fact that you pay $10 for a sandwich & over $4 for a tiny latte they don't even bring it out to you,, Buttt!! They come outside and shout your name for you to come and get it ,, why don't they just bring it!!! Coming from Beverly Hills and enjoying Urth cafe on my Sunday morning coffee this join  definitely need to stack up that service and the size of cups make no sense they gave me a large cup tree for the Americano and a tiny cup for a cappuccino what a rip off. I'm in shock that the price and size considering I live in Beverly Hills which is the most expensive place to live I think in all of America apart from New York that this little place charges more and why?

Please!

Very unhappy

Love it! Awesome ambience, good seating, lots of outlets and outdoor seating.  I haven't eaten any thing there so I can't make a review on that (thus the 4 stars instead of 5), but they do have great coffee!  I'm a screenwriter and frequent many many coffeehouses, from here to LA, to Austin, to NY so I don't give out good reviews nilly willy :) 
Not everyone can boost a great authentic cappuccino , But Brittany at Sambalatte certainly can.  Ask her to make one for you, you won't regret it!
Thanks Brittany!

Wow.  I'm not one to "hangout" at coffee shops, but Sambalatte is definitely a place I could meet friends at and just chill.  As everyone is saying the ambiance is great.

I've only been once and got a simple iced coffee.  The place definitely has a hipster vibe to it.  I'm sure I'll be back.
They have a really cool atmosphere. Probably one of the best coffee shops in Vegas. I love coming here on my days off to relax, chit-chat a bit or read a book. I always leave this coffee shop wired!

This coffee shop reminds me of one I visited many years ago in Steamboat Springs, CO.  It has a very cool vibe, it attracts some very good looking people and there is often live music you can enjoy while sipping your beverage.  I love the artwork they make out of the whipped cream on the cappuccinos.  The food and the beverages are very good but the overall atmosphere is on the top of the charts!

Cool atmosphere!  Live music on a Sunday afternoon. Variety of desserts looked delicious in the display case! Ordered an iced americano with Nutella- note to all, they use a syrup flavored Nutella, not the same Nutella from a jar. Delicious none the less! I would come here again to relax, but I would t recommend coming here if you are looking for a quick coffee before work. Parking can be a hassle.  More of a sit down and enjoy location. I will definitely be back to enjoy the ambiance next time!
Good coffee, good atmosphere. I like their Nutella & Chai tea lattes. I won't go anywhere else for my coffee (:

I love this place. It reminds me of Blue Bottle coffee from San Francisco in that they hand drip each specialty cup of coffee. But, what they don't offer is the pretentiousness. 

Their coffee and expresso drinks are excellent. I like that they offer soy or almond milk lattes. I hate to make this public because they are already so hard to get but, they have the best chocolate croissants. You need to get there early because they usually sell out by mid-day. 

This is a good place to have an informal business meeting, or to catch up with friends. CJ is our favorite barista. He always has a smile on his face.

What a great place to relax, surf the net if you want, and have lunch!  I had the tomato bisque soup which was much larger than the one in the case. Score!  The white mocha is great both warm and cold. 

Today the weather is great. They have live stung music outdoors with the front doors open so you can hear it inside.  Seating outside, inside and upstairs.
The best place to order a latte in town.     This is a great place to sit and enjoy a good cup of coffee and relax.      A perfect place to meet a friend and catch up.

First time actually coming in to get something. First time was just way to busy to even walk in. I really wish stuff were more inviting. Instead of standing there looking at me while I go over everything, cashier could have helped. There was no one ahead of me or waiting on me. Coffee is good, but I don't think I'll be back. I didn't have a good experience.
Cozy coffee shop located in close proximity to Summerlin. The lavender latte is my favorite. I would also recommend trying the assortment of macaroons, for good measure, of course.

The only reason I'm giving this spot a 3 out of 5 is I asked for a leaf design on my Nutella latte and I didn't get it. Everything from the entry way to the outdoor seating and upstairs seating as well as the nice decorations was on point. The customer service was fantastic.

I suggest to train your baristas more in coffee art. I am in the entrepreneurial business in coffee and that is my passion. The espresso is delightful medium roast and is not bitter to the taste.

When I walked into the place and tried to order the lady at the counter was very slow.. Meanwhile there were two other workers  from behind the counter that saw me and didn't even  say anything.. Very poor service! And Over priced food!!  Not wroth the money for the service. Hey at least I give them a shot.

Sometimes,you just want to have a cup of coffee and something to eat or catch up with friends or even just draw something outside your house... well, this is the place to be. I have been coming here and they have never failed me. I don't think they have ever failed anyone. Coffee-awesome
Tea-awesome
pastries- yey!
staff- super friendly
but the best part is having that environment that is still classy but relaxed. They give you wifi connection on your receipt and you are set to browse on your phone or tablet or your laptop. And they let acoustic guitarist play on Sunday mornings... I loved it because I think it's an independent guy who just wants to share his given talent and won't ask for anything but a well deserved tip. 

here's for longer success!
cheers
House coffee 16oz $2.75, Add ice to make it ice coffee, $4.00. Really? Coffee is good, but I hope the ice was made with Fiji bottled water.
love love love!!!  i go OUT OF MY WAY for the Nutella Lattes & Quiches!!!  Thanks Paul (I think that was the Baristas name... he's the extreme coffee nerd one) haha!!!
Love this place Nutella iced latte is my fav. Also love how strong the shots are. Atmosphere is also amazing
Absolutely love this place.  Great space and sometimes they have live music.
Seriously the best place. Incredible food, even better coffee, with the worlds best atmosphere either to relax or get some work done! The iced white mocha is the best!

Sambalatte is very hipster, although I do find it to be crowded when walking in. When I mean crowded, I mean chairs and tables all over the place and no walking path to make a beeline towards the counter. It's nice to know that they do have stations where you can camp out for a few hours, but still too crowded for me. 

More importantly,  the drinks were amazing. I ordered an iced nutella latte (for myself), iced mocha (for le bf), and a frappe (for le fren), and our drinks were on fleek... I mean simply delicious! I also ordered the box of macaroons ($17) and they were amazing as well! They're probably one of the few places that serve very moist and jelly-filled macaroons. Just so good!
Coffee is great when they have my dairy alternatives...except soy.  Can't do soy either sadly.    But lately it seems like they all have a little attitude as well.  Anyways, still good coffee.
Beautiful coffee shop filled with beautiful women and the wifi is fast even when the place is packed. you can't beat it.

I love cute, cozy coffee shops, so I knew I had to find a good one around town - Sambalatte did the trick! I love the setting of the place, it's adorable. I also love how they have live music playing (but to warn some: it can be pretty loud). So for their drinks and food, I've only tried their nutella latte since it was my first time. Surely, I'll be returning sometime and will be also trying out new items!

Have been here many times. I get the white mocha and my fiancé gets coffee or espresso. Drinks are always good. Wish there was more than one size of the white mocha though as they are delicious. My only complaint is a bag of coffee we purchased was a bit pricey ($18) and tasted like a super acidic stale coffee. Forget the name of it but it was one that was recommended by our barista. So we love their drinks but not their bags of coffee. Will return for their white mocha for sure!

The coolest coffee shop ever!!!! I hate coffee and I love this place. Ok for reals if you are not a fan of coffee Sambalatte well immediately convert you it did to me. 

Located in Boca Park not too far from Kona grill in a two story building house this über chic yet hip coffee shop. Along with cool latte art coffee they also serve up a long list of other sophisticated tasty treats to suite anyone's taste buds. 

Ultimately the latte is the one that got me and of coarse their French macaroons! The second level offers a little spot for private convos and game playing while downstairs in their main room sometime has small bands performing for your entertainment. Want to enjoy the brief nice weather that Vegas has to offer have no fear there is a patio near. LOL sorry for my poor man poetry...yes there is a small patio with tables and chair to enjoy the outdoor if you desire some fresh air and caffeine.  

There is now a second location THANK GOD, but this locations is my favorite.

My favorite place to come in the mornings to blog . I bring in my newborn with me and he is such a quiet good baby you wont even notice him . Anyways i love the vibe and how friendly the baristas and customers are. My son loves the music which is why i think hes always sound asleep . Im a Motherhood and Lifestyle blogger also a mom of 3 all under 3. So having another place close by where i can just think is awesome. Last week i got the Nutella Latte, so yummy! Today i tried the Raspberry White Mocha. I look forward to ordering more drinks

This place is better than Starbucks! And my barista Mikey was above and beyond professional. Even after taking our order and serving us, he came out to ask us how we are doing. I'm impressed! I'm going to look for one at home in Phoenix.

Now this is a coffee shop! Cool decor, food that makes you want to eat even though you've already eaten, and delectable, handcrafted drinks, lots of seating and power outlets too. No wonder this place got so many good reviews!

Although there were a lot of people here, I must've came after the morning rush as there was no line. I can only imagine that there might be a wait for your drink during peak times. But hey, you're probably coming here to sip and enjoy your coffee. If you're in a rush, try the large chain in the same shopping center that has garden variety coffee but has a drive thru. 

Anyway, going back to Sambalatte, they have a HUGE variety of drinks. I'm sure you'll find something. If you're a coffee connoisseur, then I'm sure they can whip up something to your liking too. I ordered the Nutella latte, which from what other Yelpers say, is one of their signature drinks. It was a huge latte and quite strong. I started to quit caffeine, so this gave me a jolt - should've gotten half-caf. 

Anyway, check this place out. A great place to relax with friends, coffice, or study.

Another great spot to hang out and just sip coffee with live music after the sun sets.
 I love sitting outside to watch people go by and just to wind down.  The coffee is good bc I am a coffee addict

Sambalatte in boca park is probably one of my favorite coffee shops to sit and chill at. Love the outdoor patio! The staff is always friendly and they have the best Nutella latte. I always get it with nonfat milk and it still tastes just as great!
The atmosphere is excellent for studying and people watching. I ordered the Nutella latte and it's amazing. They have a decent selection of pastries too.

After reading so many great reviews of this place, and since I was in the neighborhood...

It was basically just as I expected, based on the reviews. The decor and atmosphere is fantastic. Long table with outlets for your laptop, books, magazines, games, etc. Huge bonus points for the dog station thingy out front - two water bowls and hooks for the leashes.

The staff / baristas were very friendly. The prices were extremely reasonable.

I had an iced peppermint white mocha, which was absolutely delicious.

This is definitely an ideal coffee shop and place where you can chill for several hours.

I don't understand how people could leave one star ratings for Sambalatte. Everyone who works here is extremely friendly and knowledgeable about coffee, espresso, and tea. The owner knows everything there is to know about coffee and owning this business. The style and function of the place is outstanding. The loft upstairs is cozy and secluded. I could not think of a better coffee shop in the area. So whether you're just visiting or you live in the area, make sure to stop by!

Coffee and croissants reminiscent of Venice! Stopped by for an afternoon treat and couldn't be happier. The atmosphere was very warm, with live music and lots of open seating. Many patrons carrying on their conversations well after they finished their drinks, along with students working diligently. Wonderful place, we'll definitely be back! 

Recommend the flat white and almond croissant.

Just making sure to give Sambalatte the love that it deserves!

The Nutella latte is still at the top of my list and my husband loves the regular latte.  Came here tonight around 8pm and they had a jazz duo playing the trumpet and keyboard.  Absolutely LOVED it!  It just added to the charm of this coffee joint.

While their drinks are great, I'm obsessed with their macaroons.  They are a little pricey ($16.50 for 12 of them) but they are tiny bites of deliciousness!  Tonight I ordered 10 of them to go- one of each flavor and two for my husband to eat while enjoying his coffee.  They put them in a perfect little box for easy take home.  Yum!

Our friends enjoyed their gluten free almond cookies and some herbal lemonade.  She said they were both really good and her lemonade even had a pretty little flower in it!

Everyone is really nice and I'm still in love with this little relaxing gem inside of Boca Park!

What a polished venue.  Between the use of space, the color schemes, the preparation, but most of all.... the drinks.  Excellent, excellent, excellent.  

I worked about a year or so as a barista then manager over at a Starbucks and since then, was swallowed into the coffee culture that Philadelphia/NYC/NJ offered.  When I moved to Vegas, I decided I just love the environment that a great coffeehouse can offer: the aromas, friendly, casual diners, art filled mindsets, and what the hell: DELICIOUS DRINKS.

Sambalatte offers all of this, beautifully at that.  Located in Boca park, it offers coffee - each cup freshly ground and prepared so the acidity is minimal and the taste is effortless with minimal cream or sugar recommended.  (I'd like to mention the baristas were very knowledgable about each product and were very helpful.)

A giant mural of the regions of each type of coffee blend as well as a very decent offering of tea is displayed.  What made it for me was the from-scratch whipped cream that was just decadent.  

I had a nutella hot chocolate that just made my afternoon, drizzling and all, glow.  I cradled it on my way home and cursed the fact that I had work in a few hours and did not have the opportunity to enjoy the cafe to its fullest.  

The upstairs area upstairs was my type of zone - a miniature library to coil up and catch up on a few chapters and just unwind.  

I frankly can't wait to go back and try all their different drinks.  I just wish their hours were longer...

I purchased a large white tea, chocolate macaroon and a spinach frittata. A bit pricey. The tea wasn't very good, the macaroon was 2 stars but the frittata was really good 4 stars. 
The cafe is really cramped and narrow. I was going to eat there but there was no place to sit because it was so busy, which I should have expected because of the time of day (5:00 pm)

The staff is amazing (5 stars) Very professional, courteous, and attentive.
The cafe is very clean, atmosphere relaxed.

didn't get to drink the coffee...

fruit salad - good

egg white fritata was ok

very nice wait staff

I went this cafe on Sunday afternoon to relaxing my day and there was a guy named Anthem or Anthom(tall black guy at cashier) was very rude. He seems like he don't want to work.  I surprised this rude guy can working in sambalatte.

Very rude staff. One or two of the people who work here are friendly, however the negative people outweigh the positive. The quality of the coffee is mediocre and a little over priced to be honest. However, the atmosphere is the best in Las Vegas. But if you feel uncomfortable the whole time you are in there, what good is atmosphere? I tried this shop 4 times, and have been disappointed each time.

My favorite coffee place and coffee in the whole U.S! Literally! I fly all over and the only place that even comes close is Colombia, South America! My Favorite is Cafe Con Leche which no other place can make like these guys. I'm addicted to the Pumpkin Pound Cake during the fall/winter season, and Red Velvet pound cake the rest of the year. The Almond Croissant is TO DIE FOR! Love love love love this place.

Don't judge me but I LOVE their Vanilla Latte so much that I sing a little jingle about Sambalatte whenever I think about it! It's that perfect mix of coffee taste, sweet vanilla, and cream. I hate it when my coffee tastes like dessert-if I want dessert I'll go get dessert-but I love coffee, so I want to still be able to taste it...darnit! :) My hubby has tried the Nutella, and agreed the Vanilla was better, so I have never tried another flavor. Let's face it...it's so cool when they do the designs in the foam! I am a Vegas native and this was not a common treat...at least that I was made aware of. I make french press coffee at home, so I often have my hubby who works close to this location buy my coffee beans here.

I've also enjoyed their SALADS AND BISCOTTIS and definitley recommend them. The environment is enjoyable and I like to take out-of-town friends here for a special coffee break...even though it's 30 minutes away from home.

Note: this review is ONLY for the Rampart location. I went to the Jones location (about 15 min from home) in June and the salads were practically inedible, which completely threw off the rest of my experience...I can't even recall if I enjoyed my coffee. I did inform the manager, and they appeared to want to fix the issue, but I don't see myself returning to find out. Yeah...it was that bad...

I have never been to any coffee shop besides Coffee Bean or Starbucks. Sambalatte Terrefazione takes caffeine to whole other level! I walked in, glanced at the menu, and almost pulled my phone to google some of the stuff on the menu because I didn't want to look like a newbie ;x LOL! True story.

The first time I came in, I stared at the menu from a distance and since it's handwritten, I had to squint to read it (I'm bad at wearing my glasses when I need to -__-). Talk about looking even more like a newbie. With all my knowledge of coffee from Starbucks, I searched for the most familiar things and told myself, "Ahh, I've had that before... and that, and that." so I didn't order any of the familiar.  The item that stuck out to me was "afogato." Wasn't quick enough to google that one so I told the cashier (Taryn) with confidence in my voice and nervousness on my face, "I'd like to have the afogato please." And she proceeded to ask, "What type of gelato would you like in it." Losing my confident character-esque, I then said, "Oh, what's good in it?" LOL! She laughed too and suggested hazelnut gelato. I went with it and said I'll take it to go. My newbie adventure doesn't end there!

I sat down anticipating what I ordered, felt adventurous, and started a draft for my review. I looked around at the pastries that looked Venetian-worthy or something. "Oh you fancy huh!" - (c) Drake. I noticed the little island with a bunch of outlets suggesting customers to "Hey, plug in here and write a novel or two!" I walked to the entrance and noticed a grip of board games (Note: Come here and play Scrabble), and saw there was an upstairs. I didn't go up because I didn't want to miss my afogato and I was somewhat in a hurry so I decided to save that for later.

Taryn brought over my afogato in a white paper cup with a little spoon inside. I looked inside and was like "WTF is this?!" LMAO! I thanked her and walked out. I literally LOL'ed to myself when I looked at what I ordered. It looked like a cup of baby poo! LMAO! OMG! I laughed so hard to my gf on the phone and told her that I think I just ordered a cup of baby poo and coffee! Shows you how much I know about Sambalatte Tore-a-fuzz-yawn! I started eating away at the gelato and noticed it was espresso in there. STRONG! and I mean, STRONG like Iron Man strong! It was so bitter, I had to let my gf try it out (I'm so nice! haha!). Even she said it was strong and she likes her coffee strong! We kept laughing about it the whole night.

Then, I came back with her and some of our well versed coffee friends. I decided to retry the afogato, but with TWO scoops of hazelnut gelato! It tasted better and it helped with the taste of the espresso. We also tried the chocolate and pistachio biscuit. Not super great,  but tasty. There was a bunch of other fancy treats in there I'd like to try some other day.

Afogato = crack in a cup! Wheeew!

Terrible service.  Ordered a breakfast sandwich, along with a latte, tea, and muffin.  Waited over 20 minutes for the breakfast sandwich, had to remind them twice to even put in toaster oven.  Meanwhile husband finished his latte and I'm nursing this tea and muffin waiting.  They did give us our money back for the sandwich, but come on!

Came here for a long study day and it was the perfect spot! Baristas are very polite and quick with your orders and making suggestions. I got the rainbow Nutella latte and it was great! I was expecting it to be overly sweet like similar lattes in other places but this one was perfect without being over the top, in your face Nutella. 
Did get a bit loud around lunch hours but that just shows how popular of a place it is! 
Also tried the green forest smoothie which tastes more like apple juice than any of the other ingredients. I liked it but keep that in mind if you order it! 
Overall a really great study/meeting/chill place in this area!
This place is fabulous. Wonderful coffee and a myriad of other beverages, hot and cold. Upper and lower floor, pleasant decor.

My slice of heaven. It's hard to find good cafes in Vegas. Sundays they play live music which is always nice but during the acts that have an electric guitar, it gets a shade too loud to do work. They have an upstairs for extra seating as well as a mini patio in front. 

The people that come here are interesting as well, I like to people watch -- you will always see interesting folks stop by for a coffee.

Which brings me to my next point, their coffee is delicious but I like their hot tea more. They have it in large presses, perfect for enjoying multiple sips of tea. It can take awhile to get your order but that's understandable as they are usually busy. 

All in all, one of the best places to relax with friends or do work.

Five stars for ambiance. 
Five stars for product offerings.
Five stars for servers.
Five stars for work space (multiple outlets are key!)

Perfection.

This is THE best cafe in town for several reasons. Not only do they have pastries that look and taste like they come from a renowned patisserie, but their coffee isn't as expensive as chains like Starbucks or other popular cafes like It's A Grind.

The spring season is the best time to be there because the whole plaza has outdoor seating. If you want the whole European feel of cobblestone streets, soft lights and mild conversations, this is the best place in Vegas for it.

In the inside, the cafe is two stories with sofa seating and a flat screen tv, overlooking downstairs like a balcony. They also have a long table with numerous power outlets for those on laptops. Internet card is provided for those who make a purchase.

Occasionally, they will have someone singing and playing guitar. No worries, its not some stoned idiot- its someone who knows what they're doing.

Oh, and they sell macaroons. This place is flawless for a date.

Stopped by for a way too late lunch and some tea. The folks in front of me seemed to have issue because they wanted things the baristas just weren't willing to make. I ordered straight off the menu though and had no issues at all. The Backpacker sandwich was tasty, whatever the sauce was I'd go back just for that, and the berry tea I had was pretty tasty. 

But it's the vibe of the place that makes it. Just weird enough to make me forget that I was in the suburban part of Las Vegas (which is pretty much nothing but strip malls and condos/housing neighborhoods). A guy playing the guitar just inside the front door kept it light and the spacing between the tables kept it cozy. 

This is definitely the type of place I'd visit again.

Sambalatte is a super cute coffee house that is right at home in trendy Summerlin. Definitely warmer and more personal feeling than Starbucks, they have a beautiful two story seating area, with both small round tables/chairs and a long computer workstation table. They serve a variety of food and coffee choices. The service has always been very pleasant and attentive (even when they were all out of what I wanted).

I love how the coffee beverages are served in beautiful mugs with a coffee design swirled in the froth if you stay and linger. The prices are on the high side, but for the lovely environment and personal touches, I understand. Seasonally, I've tried the pumpkin spice latte as well as the gingerbread latte (pumpkin wins), and plan to try the butterscotch latte on my next visit.

I've sampled the ham and cheese croissant, and wasn't the biggest fan. The croissant was a bit TOO flaky- it makes a huge mess, and there wasn't much ham on it.  I'll likely stick to lingering over my latte next time.

I am surprised this place is sitting on four stars only. This is the best coffee joint in town, period. 

Explaining: Starbucks, being the largest coffee buyer in the world, buys predominantly B Grade coffee, there simply isn't enough A Grade coffee to supply Starbucks and the chains alike. So Starbucks ends up over roasting its coffee by two extra minutes to achieve the taste, but all it does is burns the coffee. 
Then you have the gourmet coffee shops on the strip who mostly use illy (A Grade) brand, which is really good, BUT, it takes months for the coffee to be grinded, canned and shipped to the US from Italy, and there you have it, second best, old coffee. 
 Now this little shop uses a vendor, who imports very small batches of A Grade, very select coffee beans from various parts of the planet depending on the season.
Coffee is roasted locally every Saturday, then delivered to this little coffee shop on Sunday. 
I personally buy my espresso beans here. The staff is knowledgeable enough to understand the type of espresso machine I'm using, and how to grind my beans.  
CONS:
Live music by up and coming artists is good, maybe a little too loud for the space constrained coffee shop. They have pastries imported from Paris if I am not mistaken, I wish they used local vendors, it would have been fresher and better for the community.
So now you know :)

Snobby, refined, exquisite, hipster, authentic, comfortable, delicious, and pricey.  All those adjectives apply here.  Everything they serve is fantastic and eerily authentic given that nothing in Vegas seems authentic.  Great location and you can tell the money from the area loves to chill at Sambalatte.

I frequented Sambalatte regularly, when they first opened and the food quality/service WAS stellar.  After a few scattered lackluster experiences over the past year, I agree with earlier reviews that their level of quality has plummeted.  I stopped by today and ordered a regular tea (tea bag)...I was told that they did not serve tea (????).  Excuse me??? A coffee house that does not serve tea?  I believe that the cashier (who was incredibly rude and irritated) had no idea what a tea bag (or loose leaf) was, as I've placed this order without issue dozens of times in the past.  So, I calmly settled on a latte.  Upon the cashiers final insistence (he interrupted me before I finished my order) as to whether or not my order was "for here or to go"...I walked out.  The level of service and quality (the pastries in the display unit appear shiny, plastic, "fake" and unappealing) do not meet the bourgeois airs that it's employees take on.
Super friendly staff, always clean bathrooms, great coffee/tea/espresso selection. The only negative is that they are a little pricy. All in all I recommend Sambalatte to anyone.

If you're an LA transplant like myself, you'll find this coffee shop a reminder of the hipster cafes such as Urth and Intellegentsia back home. It's got that artsy vibe, along with a wide selection of coffee choices, dessert and bakery items, and sandwiches (plus hipsters). The decor also fits the hipster category.

I ordered the nutella latte after sifting quickly through the reviews on yelp and liked it a lot. The nutella is subtle in the coffee mix, but it's definitely tasty coffee with a bit of a chocolate/hazelnut flavoring. I am looking forward to trying other items on the menu here. Try this place out if you're into coffee.
Food and drink selections were excellent.  Quick service.  Fortunate to have found the recommendation online

As a girl born and raised in Las Vegas, I was delighted to know such a hip place existed. This place has the perfect ambience for a nice chat with your friends or for some serious study time. I love all of the available outlets so it's a perfect place to browse the internet and get work done.

This place definitely brings back memories of Paper or Plastik back in LA. The nutella cappuccino is the bombdotcom but I usually go for the teas. The ginger peach tea is amazing and the staff is nice and friendly.

Great coffee...amazing atmosphere! The staff is very friendly and the baristas know what they're talking about. One of my favorite places out here. Do yourself a favor and try the chemex pot. It adds Such a clean smooth flavor.

I was so excited to finally try the pumpkin spice rainbow latte. Unfortunately the Brista that was working that day ruined my entire experience. Now I Remember why it's been so long since I have came here. They advertise their cool designs yet when you ask them to make a design they get so upset. If you're not happy with your job it's simple don't work there don't ruin other people's experience. I think maybe they forget we're paying seven almost 8 dollars for a cup of coffee the design makes the entire experience. Now I will definitely not be returning. Thanks samblatte.
Best coffee I've ever had. Beats Starbucks any day. Iced latte is wonderful. I love the whole vibe of this spot. They need another location in Town Square!

Can you say Nutella Latte three times fast?! You can after you've had one! Super yummy! The staff was cool, the food was a good offering, especially for macaroon lovers! There is courtyard seating, laptop desks, cozy chairs and upstairs seating for those who want a little privacy! Their Torrefacione coffee beans are the best in these parts!

The thing I like most about this place is the amount of outlets they have. During school, I'm a big fan of doing my studying and work in a coffee shop. But a lot of the time, I find that there aren't enough outlets for those who bring their laptops. Something, that definitely isn't a problem here. 

They have a nice selection of different coffees to choose from, which I appreciate. And the vanilla latte I had was quite good. Like a lot of others said in their reviews - the designs they make on their drinks are quite cool. I haven't had a chance to try and of their pastries, salads, or sandwiches - but I definitely will the next time I go. 

They also have a lot of pretty interesting contraptions. And the way they brew their coffee, definitely isn't the way that most coffee shops do it. It does take a bit longer just to get a cup of coffee, but it's worth the wait. I'm a huge tea person, so it was nice to see that they do offer loose leaf tea. I was disappointed however, when I saw that they used a press to steep the tea. 

Lastly, one thing that bothers me about this place is it's location. Boca Park is a very busy place, and is always filled with people. Therefore, trying to find parking becomes a hassle. I've never had to search so long to get a parking spot just to get into a coffee shop.

Too hot inside. Slowest barista on earth. Cashier slow too...ordered an espresso ristretto and was served with the usual 2oz of coffee....barista insisted that 21 grams of ground coffee will produce an espresso....no for an italian-espresso-ficionado.  Price is good gor dine-in service....but please have you baristas cover thosr hugly spiderman-skulls-like tatoos!!!... they don't melange well with ambience!!!

Great coffee shop/cafe!!
