And served with pretty coffee art. I have only had the macaroons and the quiches, but I can say both are phenom!!!! The quiches are buttery and flaky with just the right amount of egg and fillings. I have had the veggie and Loraine, though the veggie is my fave. And the macaroons are bite size with just the right amount flaky crunch before you sink your teeth into the gooey center. 
     At this point Sambalatte is by far my favorite coffeehouse in Las Vegas. It is such a delight and I am so happy to have found this gem. Enjoy!

Great coffee!

Hip environment!

Pretty good chow. although, I can only really comment on the pastries. They are decadent enough that you want more!

They have free wifi that is very fast (according to my speed checker app) and there are plenty of plug ins for your laptops.

I really like that they support local businesses and carry their products. The coffee from Colorado river roasters is pretty good and I can buy the loose beans there for my home coffee fix.

If i lived in summerlin I would be here all the time. in the meantime, I will just have to go there for my afternoon fix while I am at work.

There are many locations for Sambalatte but this is by far my favorite one. It is inside of Boca Park a few stores down from Cheesecake Facotry and Grimaldi's. To a lot of people's surpise, its actually 2 stories.   A lot of people come here to study  on their lap tops since there are two table with outlets, one on each level. They also have a few tv's in the place.  Everything about this place is charming, from the convinient outside tables, bowls of water for dogs, the large coffee cups with the pretty designs they do with ur coffee, and the second floor with a few more chairs to lounge on. 

One of my favorite drinks is the Nutella latte which is super popular, and their chai latte. They have a few different food selectiosn from pastries, cupcakes, sandwiches, and a few others.

My favorite coffee shop in Vegas! I love to sit at their little tables and enjoy a cup of delicious coffee... Makes me feel like I'm in San Francisco. 

I wasn't much of a macaroon fan but this has changed since I tried the French macaroons here. Pistachio, almond and coconut are my personal favorites. 

As for the coffee, I would highly recommend their Ethiopian and Guatemalan coffees. I tried their Nutella cappuccino and it was pretty good as well. Not quite as flavorful as I expected, but still good. 

They also have delicious iced teas!  Very refreshing on a hot summer day.  They even serve them with a fresh flower in them. Such a nice touch!

The crustless egg white veggie quiche was good, but not great. One of my favorite food items would have to be their fruit salad. My friend tried their croque monsier and he was highly impressed. 

There are so many drink options and their pastries, sandwiches and salads look amazing as well. This is a place I will be visiting any chance I get!

I hadn't been here in a while. I managed to stop by on an early Friday evening and was happy to find the place quiet and not too crowded. As usual, the place has all the appearances of a pleasant cafe in which to work. However, there were a couple hiccups. 

1) They haven't updated what appears to be a chalk menu in several months. I remember trying to order the iced lavender earl grey months ago and being told they no longer have it. Again, I was told the same thing (since I forgot I had tried to order it before). Instead, I ordered it hot. I was told it would come in a French press, but instead it was steeped in a teapot. (Which isn't a big deal. Just a bit strange).

2) The staff was friendly, but the two genteman seemed like they need a bit of extra training. They didn't seem to know how to make the coffee pour my friend requested; instead, they just said they didn't have it. And when he got a French press coffee instead, they didn't bring him the French press either. They brought it in a large mug. And unfortunately, the coffee was burnt.

3) We ordered a BLT sandwhich. It was premade and merely reheated. The quality was so-so. The grainy bread was a nice choice. But I recommend that a cafe of this appearance should at least prepare sandwhiches fresh. 

Overall, the 3 stars is for ambiance and decor. It's not a bad place to work or hold a small meeting.

This place was recommended to me by my friend who sells her cupcakes there and let me just say I was not disappointed. The coffee is awesome and the people are friendly. They sure do know their coffee. I'm more of a sweet coffee drinker but a staff member suggested the flat white which is just espresso and silkened milk and I was hooked. The only complaint I have about this place is that they need to educate their staff about the desserts because no matter which one I asked about the answer was let me check or I don't know. Other than that the whole vibe of this place is awesome a true coffee shop in the middle of a busy shopping center.

I loved their tea selections and expressos , i loved there tea habiscus its was fresh and delicious, its very nice n chill to catch up with friends or just grab a book and relax great staff and they proces are very good probably better than starbucks i think .

Came by the other day to grab a cup of coffee. 

The Nutella Latte that Yelpers were raving about was excellent! Temperature was great and it was well frothed with fantastic latte art. It wasn't too sweet either!

They have a nice area upstairs with power outlets and Wifi to get some work done!

$5.25 for a Nutella Latte

Free Wifi!

This place is awesome!

I already got a good impression because the interior was spot on, mainly its ambience. It's a good study and hang out place. I went to the counter, and noticed the lack of staff's people skills. I ordered a nutella latte and an egg white frittata. Unfortunately, it was no longer available, which was why I opted for a quiche lorraine instead. 

My nutella latte tasted amazing! I tasted a good flavor of espresso and hints of nutella at the same time. My quiche lorraine came in a little late. The staff tried to appease me by saying that they did a refund, and that it was on the house. I liked the texture of my quiche. The crust was flaky and the filling was creamy, but it was really salty! I ordered pistachio, cappuccino and almond macarons to go. They all had nice and chewy consistency which I like. I tasted a good amount of cappuccino flavor but the pistachio and almond did not deliver. 

I am giving them 4/5 stars. I would have given them 5/5 if not for the bad service.

Great ambiance and coffee, but the dessert (I got a tiramisu and another cake - chocolate and hazelnut for 2 people) was overpriced and not worth the $7 per cake. Loved the live music. They also have board games and free wifi.

Sadly, Sambalatte is overpriced. However, their priceless ambiance makes it worth it. The decor and small details gives an ordinary coffee shop a large personality. 

I've had the Nutella latte and the Nutella hot chocolate but personally think that the hot cocoa had more flavor. The latte lacked the Nutella flavor IMO.

Restrooms are clean, hours are pretty good, and the location is in an awesome complex. I'm excited for them to be opening their second location at Monte Carlo!

I was there this morning and it was busier than we thought, coffee was great!
Atmosphere and music was warming and Barista was very friendly,Nil made sure we like our coffee and everything is as we want it. We had a good time with Nil while she was making our Nutella latte.
Ask for almond croissant barista Nil and Nutella latte when you go there.
SOOOOOOOOOO OVER-RATED!!!!! oh man... The only cool thing about this coffee shop is the really cool environment and the super friendly staff...other than that, the coffee is boring!

You have the pour over I want. You have 16 oz coffee cups. I have money.

Just put the coffee in the cup I want and charge me. Don't tell me you can't. Don't make it sound like you're pulling strings for me when you decide to do it.

Just pour the coffee I want in the cup in I want and charge me. Or get rid of that size. It's obnoxious.

I came here for the first time to get a latte, since they are known for their lattes. It was noon and the expresso machine was broken !!! The lady said it had happen before and they are not sure why or how long it will take to fix!
     I was so disappointed that I didn't know what else to get! They were so passé about it as if it's normal for a latte place to have No Lattes! 
     The customer service was unfriendly and extremely slow! I went back an hour later to get my drink to go and I waited at the register while 4 other employees stood around and talked, laughing doing nothing related to helping a customer waiting right in front of their face! 
     I gave two stars because the ice coffee and sandwich I had was very tasty. 
     I would not come again unless a friend asked me too. I rather give my money to a place with good coffee and pleasant/ speedy customer service!

I've been here a  few times already. It kind of reminds me of a coffee shop up near UC Berkeley. It's cozy, but sometimes gets a little crowded. At least there is indoor/outdoor, as well as upstairs seating. Free wi-fi.  I like that they have live music too. Breakfast sandwiches are served all day. Love the French Country Sandwich -  it literally melts in your mouth. Nice variety of desserts. The coffee, (i've tried both the iced mocha and hot mocha), is excellent - skip the Starbucks and come straight here! The smoothies are tasty too. The only downside I can think of is that it's a little pricey.  2 sandwiches and a couple of drinks will put you in the $20+ dollar range. All in all, a good experience. I'll keep coming back here to get my Saturday afternoon caffeine fix!

Typical over priced coffee shop. I payed $4 for a small tea and they wouldn't even refill my press pot with hot water. ITS ONLY HOT WATER!!! Instead they told me I would have to pay another $4 for another tea. I don't want another tea or new tea leaves. All I want is some HOT WATER! Is that too much to ask for? Apparently. Besides that, the place is fine, good music, and very lively.

Amazing coffee shop with a equally fantastic ambience.  Come here for their Macha lattes as often as I can make it over.  Today have been here twice and love the fact that they are always so consistent.  The staff is also great and always knowledgeable when I ask them about their outstanding pastries and salads.
Chocolate cappuccino! Serously. Best ever.

Highly recommended. I had a small issue the other day but it was quickly addressed by the manager, Alexander. He was very understanding and I truly appreciated his assistance! Sambalatte is also a great environment to get work done...plently of outlets,  not too loud, and reliable wifi. Love this place.
I enjoy this place for the tea since I am not a coffee drinker, in the afternoons they have music and is also great for people watching.
Nice Sunday morning crowd with a marvelous slide guitar player sharing some country blues. Ice coffee from a bottle? Not bad after all...
Cool for Vegas. Seems like Orange County, but not in a bad way.

I had this place bookmarked for a while now and also had high hopes for this place, but this place had by far the worst tasting coffee I have ever came across.

My sister ordered a dirty chai latte, and it was way too bitter for her tasting. They gladly replaced her $5 dirty chai latte with a Nutella cappuccino which was a $3.75 drink. When a customer is not satisfied with a drink, shouldn't you replace it with something of at least EQUAL value? 

I ordered the Nutella cappuccino, and it was a horrible mistake. For $3.75 my drink came in a little tiny teacup. Two of three sips and then it's gone, and it wasn't even that good. I couldn't taste the Nutella in my drink at all, and I didn't bother trying to replace it because my sister already asked to replaced her drink and I didn't want to seem like a bother.  

One star for the macaron. People have different preferences when it comes to their coffee, but how they replaced my sister's drink for something less in value is considered horrible customer service to me. I don't expect to be coming back.

I always go here when i'm in vegas. The coffee is excellent and food is great as well.

The only complaint I have is lack of comfortable seating. I often go here with family so some loungy couches or chairs would be nice instead of the hard garden bench they have.
Please put in some nice comfortable seating!

Had a pour over here for a reasonable price of $3. Unfortunately the barista had no clue on making a proper pour over. No patience to let the coffee brew and no scales = watered down coffee. Oh, and it was luke warm too. Drank a few sips and left. Please train your staff. Disappointing considering this place is considered to be good coffee in Vegas.

The lavender latte was outstanding, wish I could say the same about the staff. Every time I come here they are rude and obnoxious or clueless. Is there some kind of rule that if you work here you have to be mean and nasty? This is not a place that I recommend people because of the lack of customer service and the downright nasty attitudes of the people that work here.

This place is awesome! I havent had that "feel" since I was in Houston.
 It's got books you can read, magazines laid out, a patio where dogs are welcome, and Gluten Free treats!
 The coffee drinks are amazing, prices slightly lower than Starbucks, but MUCH smaller servings.
 Tasted great, and was stunningly oresented.
 The food was great, and the ambience rocks.
 Well worth the drive.

4 stars for service and creativity. The latte didn't taste super amazing but it sure did look it. I would definitely frequent this establishment and take visiting family and friends here but I don't see myself becoming a weekly regular. The ambiance and vibe that this location has is amazing. It has a downstairs and upstairs location, a giant world map painting on the wall, and plenty of seating. It kind of reminds me of a library. Everyone was so nice when I went in, being new to town and curious, I struck up a brief conversation with my barista to ask what it is that makes sambalatte unique and she said it was the rainbow lattes (which is what I had) and I asked how they get the color in it (since everyone on my social media was asking - and I didn't have an answer). It's food coloring in the steamed milk for those curious minds!
Staff really nice. . .set-up really cool. . .BEST iced mocha I've ever had!

I don't generally rate a place on "value" but rather on it's overall quality.  This place is somewhat pricey for what you get but everything I had was delicious.  Note: I did not get coffee.  See below for what I bought.

So far, I've had one of their mixed berry tarts and their Italian sandwich.  Both were warmed up for me.  Really nice pastry on the tart and the berries had that nice combination of sweet and sour that I like.  Most places oversweeten the berries or just put them on fresh.  Sambalatte did a good job balancing the flavors.
The sandwich was nice too.  They put a nice olive oil on the bread - the oil was such good quality I checked the sandwich to see if there was olive in there.  Very nice ingredients, nice bread, and it was warmed just right.
Also have had their Arnold Palmer lemonade they keep in the fridge towards the back.  That was really tasty.
Have to say...I always wondered where those clothes you see in fashion shows were worn.  Always assumed people would wear them to parties and red carpet events but always wondered who wore those day to day - especially outside Manhattan, London, or Paris.  I wonder no longer - they all go to Sambalatte at 3 pm in the afternoon on the weekday.  Seriously, if I had stolen all the clothes the women were wearing in that place and sold them at full retail I could buy a Ferrari.

This place is super cute! The staff is friendly. Hard to find a seat inside it gets packed! There was a guitar player. Kind of cool laid back atmosphere. I ordered an iced hazelnut latte to go and it was delicious and it was  ready even before I was done browsing the delicious dessert selection! I'll definitely be back! So much to try!

This has every bit of potential to be one of the greatest coffee shops in town. The coffee is excellent - personal favorite being the Nutella latte (iced or hot), the latte art is pretty, it has a beautiful setting with an upstairs loft included, there are great/knowledgeable baristas, and cute live performances. 

It is far from where I live, but my previous boyfriend lived close by so I would spend a lot of time here last year with him and it was never to study or read, simply to have a drink, talk, and spend some time together. 

So I never had issues with locating a spot to study. I came to enjoy the ambiance. Sometimes it would be a little crowded and full of hipsters, but I don't pay attention to too much noise around me to let it bother me anyway. It's definitely a coffee shop made for socializing now.

I have never tried any of their food items because they are overpriced, however I always wanted to try a macaroon or two. 

I always wanted them to open a sambalatte in the Henderson area, but I'm afraid it would become overcrowded as this one, so I guess I favor a more smaller, intimate independent coffee shop over this one to read, study and relax in.

Simply the best coffee place in the whole USA especially this location (the first one opened) the owner " Luis " is always around making sure that the machines the grinders and the stuff are all working at 100% and the best possible coffee is served to the clients. If by any reason you don't like your drink just go back to the barista and he/she will fix it with no attitude and will make it again the way you like it.
I'm there many times during the day sometimes for meetings cause the atmosphere and the vibe is also very elegant relaxing and comfortable.
I only have 5 stars otherwise I could have put 6

Oh samba... My favorite hipster coffee place. It's pretty expensive depending on what you get but honestly so worth it. I absolutely love all their different varieties of coffee and teas, and their awesome food. This is my go to spot when I want to meet up with a friend or get some work done because of its comfortable and luxe environment. Love it!

I find out that Sambalatte uses Colorado River Coffee Roasters which is a local coffee company and one with quality beans that I can drink. I have the weirdest thing with coffee - some make me very sick when they're high acidity and high caffeine and it seems I can't drink it with dairy. Sadly, I really enjoy fine coffee, but its a rare indulgence. 

The decor inside is nice and there is free wifi with lots of plug ins which is also kinda the problem. It's busy and hard to find seating and most people doing work will be there forever and some people gave no fucks it was busy and hung out chatting well after their drinks were done. We lucked out upstairs and found some stools.

The BF got a white latte with half caffeine and this was a solid latte, definitely well made. I got the nutella latte and while it was a good cup, I didn't detect any nutella flavor in it at all.... was it forgotten perhaps? 

It's a solid beverage, but I'm not sure if I quite like staying here. I wanted to drink my latte and get the fuck out. There's just something in the vibe, the busy buzz of this place that doesn't make it quite relaxing. This is antithetical to what I believe a good cafe should be. It means they are successful and the coffee is good if they're busy, but I think I'll enjoy it to-go next time. Picky? Maybe, but like I said I rarely get to drink coffee so it should be a overall experience to really get me.

As great as Sambalatte is, what is even better is their location.  The plaza that it is located in, is your one stop shop for getting coffee, buying wine, and trying on clothing.  The coffee scene in Las vegas is saturated with Starbucks, i was happy when i discovered the independent Sambalatte.  In this 2 floored coffee shop, there isn't a shortage of seating, both indoor and out.  With their full and extensive menu, all of your coffee needs are fulfilled.  I ordered an iced caramel latte, which with the las vegas heat, was totally satisfying.  As good as the drinks were, their macarons were excellent.  I am unsure if they are made in house, but they were a great treat to go along with my beverage.

This coffee shop in Boca Park is totally cute.  It reminds me of a trendy coffee shop in Seattle or something.  I'm no longer in school, but this would totally be a comfortable spot to plug in your laptop and study.  

When I was there, they had a Jason Mraz-y guys singing with his guitar.. he was actually really good.  Made us sit there longer than we expected.

Its slightly pricey in my opinion, but its good.  I'm not huge on coffee or whatever.  The Nutella latte was strong, but tasty.  I can't speak to the other drinks there... but I did notice they had a large tea selection.  Looking forward to my next visit for a Chai tea.  I got a macaroon too... kind of pricey at $1.25 each?  I don't know, maybe it's because I'm so used to stuffing my face with them at buffets.

Anyway, the place is awesome.. there are board games in the comfortable upstairs.  I could picture myself sitting at a table playing jenga with friends for awhile here.  

The ambience really makes this place.  Not bad at all!

Different that what we read on the website, it completely it's own place.  

No corporate bones about it.  Lots of outlets, good individual or two person seating, and a patio.  A little upstairs area ta boot.

I had the Red Rock Latte, oh my deliciousness.  That would be my go to drink if I lived in the area.  Beautiful.  My friend had a latte with the pretty color thing... it wasn't as pretty as we hoped and it dyed her tongue blue.  SO I'd not advise that direction.  However, in a sea of corporate coffee shops, this place is a gem.

My chai latte was lukewarm. Coffee was more on the watery side. Seating was crowded and inconvienent. Service was offstandish and slightly rude. Croissant was awful and beyond dry. 
Overpriced. Wont be coming back anytime soon.

Sambalatte is one of my favorite places to lounge, drink coffee/tea, converse, or catch up on some reading.  Before you walk in, there are tables outside, often occupied, with people studying, sipping, and staring. This prepares you for what is to come after you pull the door open to enter the place.  On a Saturday afternoon - evening, you will most likely encounter a crowd of people doing the exact same thing as the people in the front.  One thing that is different, though, is the ambience inside, with canonical books and well-known magazine publications on their shelves, the humungous map of coffee-bean cultivators of the world, and the occasional independent musicians who perform there, playing originals and syncopated notes from a trumpet player to cover-songs of Abba on a violin and Bruno Mars sung by a hipster with his acoustic guitar.  Yes, I go here for the performances just to enjoy my coffee experience, sometimes. 

The line to order doesn't take too long.  The same goes for the wait to receive your order.  Besides drinks, you can also find sandwiches, quiches, macarons, cookies, and all types of desserts here.  As far as drinks, I almost always get something cold and anything with Nutella or Matcha Green Tea.  A few days ago, I had their Matcha frappe - and it made my whole weekend.  The tea had a hint of savoriness, perhaps the matcha powder gives it this kick, which was great alongside the subtle sweetness.  The iced-nutella latte - needs no explanation.  I will tell you that they smear nutella on the sides of the inner cup - yes.  

I currently live in the Southwest, so I was happy to hear that they are building a Sambalatte on Jones and the 215.  

Overall, if you want to get a well-rounded coffee drinking experience, then go to Sambalatte.  Make sure you go on their Facebook and check out the upcoming artists, if you want to check them out live.  If you want to study and drink coffee, and don't mind people talking around you, then you can study here too (there is a large study table with a several outlets you can use to plug in).  I do wish they would close a bit later, though.

Sambalatte Boca Park it's really awesome. Must say the best place for me for good coffee and for some light food.
Really nice atmosphere. Great job guys

I've been to @sambalatte once and I effing love this place!  Great atmosphere, service and product!

I stay nearby with some regularity and I am already looking forward to a return trip to this place.

Cool coffeehouse here!
I work from home a couple days per week, so I like to take a break and work from here for a couple of hours. Best atmosphere, coffee is great, and the staff is very friendly!

Its cute, stylish, chic and they make a damn good cup of coffee. But refusing to refill a $5 cup of tea is mildly absurd. 

I work and write at my best in comfortable environments and Sambalatte has a cozier feel than your run-of-the-mill coffee chain. It doesn't hurt that they're in the heart of Summerlin so you can do some of your best people-watching here. They're indoor-outdoor setup is excellent for socializing and studying alike. The co-working table downstairs is outlet-friendly and has the best lighting for reading and working. They also have a small upstairs area and a patio to sip alfresco. 

They have a high quality bean selection to choose from. Plus, you have a choice of a ceramic or paper cup to-go. Their rise to fame is the Nutella Latte. A few others spots in town make it but Sambalatte certainly makes it the best. Their baristas seem to be well-trained and really know how to operate those fancy expresso machines to their maximum potential. Nothing is worse than milk that resembles stiff soap suds. 

They have an excellent tea selection of white, black and green teas. They're definitely quality and not the generic Tazo stuff. I do have a gripe with the fact they won't re-steep. The customer is always right--right? If a paying customer wants hot water, they get hot water? I'm no tea expert but my STI-certified friend said there's nothing wrong with re-steeping. The leaves will emit a different flavor but it all depends on personal preference. Even the tea snobs do it at least once. Now, the question is are they out for $$$ or do they truly believe that tea leaves should NEVER be re-steeped...

SERVICE is less than satisfactory. I haven' t had a pleasant experience dealing with the people behind the counter. They're either socializing with each other or working too slowly to satisfy the occasionally massive line of customers. If traffic is slow, they're generally not at attention to take your order. Because waiting 5 minutes for someone to take your order is acceptable here.

Tea, coffee, ambiance are all winners. Service and strange rules are not.
Good place to hang out to study or hang out and people watch, nice music selection, comfy seats.  Had the mocha iced.

If you want your coffee beans ground fresh right in front of you and then brewed old school style in a 1 cup filter, this place is for you. The only place I have ever experienced this was a coffee roasting cafe in Montana. Coffee here is outstanding, none of that burn't overoasted taste you find in other places. Really something unique in Vegas! After trying a coffee and desert in SambaLatte you'll say Starbucks Schmarbucks! Deserts are top notch too with fresh whipped cream, yum! My wife loves the sandwiches here as well.

I just had a coffee there, but the service was nice and the coffee was great. The location is tucked away in a mall. They are open when every other store there is still closed. The traditional Italian coffee house ambiance is great.

Favorite thing about this place: is that it's the only coffee shop in Vegas (that I know of) that  has a 2nd floor! (2nd floor is small, but if you can get a table up there, it's cozy & a little quieter. I prefer it over the 1st floor which can get loud & hectic when it's busy.)

I first came here (in 2010? 2011?) to try the Nutella Latte...and it was delish! I've had a few of their other coffee drinks, smoothies & teas which are okay. I had the macarons (have had better) and a few of their desserts and they were okay as well. None of the food were mind blowing or unique. Most memorable is the Nutella Latte & Nutella Cappucino. 

I've been here several times, it's my favorite place to meet up with friends and colleagues when we're working on a new project or event. 



A few other good things about this place: 

- They have cute bookshelves with a variety of games & books you can read while you're there. 

- some nights they have live music.

- *** Another favorite thing about this place is that most times I've been here I've randomly started conversations with some fascinating and ambitious people here. 

- fave meetup spot with friends who live on the north or west side of town  

- I have brought all my out of town family and friends here. They're always excited to try the Nutella Latte.

- outdoor seating 

- doggie water station outside! 

- the long table with outlets for those who want to set up camp and get some work done. 

- the world map on the wall with all the places coffee is grown.

- And best of all....The Vibe. The decor and ambiance makes me feel like I'm in a real coffee house in NYC or Cali.

One con: it's almost always a packed house. Makes it hard to find a table and chairs.
A little pricey and always seems to be crowded. Not the best coffee I've tried, but it looks like a nice little coffee shop.

Over priced weak coffee, wasn't hot either. Super disappointed in that after reading reviews. Ordered an espresso and it was very good. Food came and I was very surprised at how good it is. It's overpriced and has a matching stuffy atmosphere. I won't be back, but food and espresso are good & that's probably most important.

What a way to wake up in Las Vegas...

Just the aroma of this place is heavenly. You MUST try the Nutella latte, it's a dream in a cup. The staff is great and when they present your latte they make sure to make it pretty by putting a little design in the froth. The little details really make me happy. 

The only negative of this place is you have to make your way through the crowd of hipster aspiring writers with their apple computers and fedora hats to get to your cup of coffee. A little pretentious but don't all good things come with a price. 

Double thumbs up!

The gnu coffee I mentioned in my review has been discontinued. The other coffees are still awesome. I just discovered that even their frappes kick the shit out of Starbucks' frappucinos. Currently enjoying the hell out of a tahitian vanilla frappe. :)

Lovely trendy Cafe. Lots of upstairs seating  with a nice view and some outdoor seating as well. Take a coffee or tea break when you're in Boca Park on W Charleston and Rampart! Coffee price is reasonable. Sandwiches are good so are pastries. Very relaxing atmosphere.

This place is great for studying and or catching up with a friend. Their latte's are good but a little light for me so I always order it with an extra shot of expresso. The  service here is great and the atmosphere is nice. My go to latte here are the red rock rock and the nutella latte. It is not too sweet and the drinks are well made. the staff here is also very friendly.
The atmosphere is really nice but it gets too crowded sometimes. The coffee tastes watery and the food isn't fresh.

I usually go there, the staff are very friendly, specially the store manager; nil such a fun and like-minded, and focused person, if you're hesitating to chose your drink ask her, she's completely willing to help you. I also like the live music which most of time is playing in the cafe, and also the selection  music is fantastic from different genres and culture. The artwork on the walls are beautiful too and I really like them. The atmosphere also is so positive and friendly specially the patio's. I definitely go there whenever I get the chance and don't miss red Rock Lotte and Nutella latte when you go there.

This is a nice location with a very pleasing ambiance and decor. They serve good quality coffees, and have STEVIA! This was my first visit and i will likely return based on the offering and location. 

I am always surprised by small shops that price themselves much higher than Starbucks and have smaller sized beverages. Compettition is not always about price, but $5 for a 16oz Americano versus $3.75 for a 20oz at Starbucks surprises me.

Quant little coffee shop with unique, and awesome lattes, mochas, oh and food. The muffins are great, and the sandwich and other deserts on display look tasty. 

Nice spot to just sit and relax either outside or inside with their two story set up. Been here twice to meet up with friends, and will be back again.

I've heard so many good things about this place, and finally made a visit here recently. The actual place and location is very nice and colorful with nice interesting decor everywhere. They have a live band playing outside and makes this place feel hip and alive. Although the lead singer had some serious pitch problems and wasn't a very good singer lol.

As for the coffee. I like the big mug it comes in and its presentation. But in all honestly, I've had better coffee/hot chocolate/matcha latte's elsewhere. It feels a little hyped up and underwhelming. It's still a great coffeehouse in all aspects, and I would recommend this place to my friends regardless. 

This place is inside the Boca Park plaza's. This plaza is one of my new favorite spots in Vegas and I don't even live near Summerlin. All the collective businesses here compliment each other in the most intriguing way. Makes the guests always coming back for more. The desserts here are very good and I think they are honestly better than the coffee's/beverages they offer here.

Any place you can set up camp for 3 hours and still not feel ready to go is doing something right! The only thing missing here is an overstuffed couch and more space to accommodate the coffee-crazed Boca-neers (my new nickname for people who look like they belong in Boca Park.) Once or twice during my 3-hour encampment I felt I should move to make room for additional guests, but... I couldn't do it. It was cold outside and warm and delicious inside. 

If you are ridin' solo, you are in luck, as there is a large table with numerous outlets for you to plug in and knock out some computer work. There is also an upstairs with a large, communal table and some additional seats. However, groups of 2 or more may struggle to find a comfortable spot depending on how busy it is. The bistro tables are a little small, definitely not 2 laptop friendly. However, both times I have been there, I have had no inclination to get work done! It is too friendly inside to hide in a computer screen. I never even tested the free WiFi even though I had my computer!

As for the liquid refreshments, I have been on a Nutcracker kick sampling both the mocha and the tea. Both were quality. The coffee is roasted locally, which is a nice touch, and I am impressed that they have a full tea menu in addition to the extensive coffee delights. Often times tea gets overlooked. I haven't explored the pastry counter, but if looks could kill, you wouldn't want to gaze too long at those windows of decadence! 

I think they should work on their delivery system a little. I never knew if I should stand around waiting for my drink or wait for them to call my name or... maybe I am easily confused. I felt a little goofy because I would sit down and then get back up and then sit down and... it was a caffeine waltz of sorts. 

Still, Sambalatte delivers a delicious product in a cozy atmosphere, a rare treat in Las Vegas. If you see me there, don't expect me to get up any time soon.

This place was horrible! Not only was the place crowded, but it was super hot inside! They just had the fans blowing slowly. I swear it felt better in the 100 degree weather outside!

First off, the Macaroons were mini. Which was okay for me until she told me it was $15 for a box of 10 mini Macaroons. What a rip off! They wern't even that great either. I ended up buying three boxes because it was for other people and I didn't feel like going to other places an hour before I left Las Vegas.

Then I ordered a Nutella Iced Coffee. It didn't even taste like Nutella! It tasted like an Iced Coffee but it was even strong or sweet. So yea, not good at all!

I thought this place was overpriced for nasty coffee and mini Macaroons.

I really do like this place.

It was a fun find and I love the upstairs loft, you can grab your yummy latte and a quick bite (as per my usual gapes, cheese and bread) and enjoyed them upstairs with a good book.

This place does stay busy pretty much all day so be prepared to share a table if you bring your laptop at the laptop table where they provide outlets for charging.

If you bring your puppy, they provide a watering bowl outside in the seating area, so very convenient when casually taking the day in with one of your best friends.

Fun place, love the lattes, the baristas are really good at experimenting and help you find the best drink for you.
Their drip is also very smooth and not bitter or burnt tasting if your in the mood for just a good strong cup of coffee.

In true, English Major/nerd fashion, I've taken it upon myself to start a book club, and I was searching for places to hold it.  

Someone recommended Sambalatte to me, and I was hesitant...I had a less than great experience at another location, and felt that they were a little pricey for the quality.

Well. 

This location was very different.  
First of all they were PACKED, inside, outside and upstairs.  Luckily, it was only going to be me, my fella, and one other reader, so I found a cozy spot upstairs, got settled, and then went down for a drink.

I ordered a chocolate cappuccino, and 2 almond macaroons.  
It was about $7 with tax...still a little pricey, but when I got upstairs and took a sip and a bite, I was happy. 

The cappuccino had a great flavor, and while they could have mixed the chocolate a tiny bit better, I was really pleased.  

The macaroons were light, airy, and amazing.  

Fella got a ginger peach hot tea.  He enjoyed it, but the girl did not give him enough tea leaves in the press of hot water...it was REALLY weak.  Next time, we will have to be more vocal about needing more leaves, as he mentioned it, but was ignored.

My service was friendly.  Fella's not so much, but I'll let him write his own review.
The kid who rang me up was friendly, and curious about the book club.  

I enjoyed my stay. 
They had a musician playing the lap steel guitar, which was awesome.  

I will definitely come back.

A local told me he was taking me to the best coffee in Vegas.  It was so good!!  We had one of the specialty coffees that they are known for.  I just asked for mild to medium and she directed me to one with a hint of vanilla.  I normally drink my coffee with cream and splenda but this was so smooth it didn't need anything extra.  I also enjoyed an almond croissant that was to die for!  

Ambiance was cute and intimate.  Great for conversations with friends.  I happen to be staying at Red Rock hotel and it's just a few blocks away.  I'll definitely enjoy the coffee and pastries here again!

My sister and I stop by Sambalatte a few times but in the evening and the crew was very nice, however, today the cashier lady was very rude.  She was nice to the customer behind me though because she kept wanting to help her instead of me.  I ordered (nicely as always) but not only did she seem unhappy to help me she seem to want to help the customer behind me instead.  She put the muffin I ordered on a plate but I wanted it to go (she didn't ask me)  so I had to interrupt her conversation with the customer behind me which she seem unhappy about.  At the end of the transaction she didn't even say thank you she practically threw the receipt at me.  

I still gave a 4 star because most the time the staff are nice and I love the pastries and coffee. I will probably avoid going there in the day time, though.

As a college student, I have been trying hard to find a place to study whenever I am for breaks. I am always at the library at school so that's the last place I want to go to if I am home. Finally there's a solution. It's this place. 

I like how the atmosphere is really open. Right when you walk in you see people on their computers and they even have a long table with a set of power outlets for students to plug in their Macs and go. 

The food here is pretty good too. The green tea I got was smooth and inexpensive. The apple tort was delicious but on the pricey side. I live near Anthem and I drove all this way to see if it was a good place to do work. I chugged out my paper and used the rest of my time to write this review and start doing other stuff.

The lighting is bright and the environment is conducive to either chill out with friends or read a book on your own. They even have an upstairs loft area that I have yet to check out. Definitely will be using this place from now on as a hang out.
This place is perfect. Best raspberry mocha I've had ever. The croissant sandwich was amazing. Literally everything about this place is perfect. I will continue to go as long as I live in Vegas!

For quite a bit of time I've been looking to find a coffee house that would have the right blend of good coffee, good ambiance at an affordable price. So I decide to try this coffee house in Summerlin having seen good reviews I had hoped to find that kind of place that would be well balanced.

First thing first I enjoyed the ambiance, the interiors are well planned and opened. They had a good singer and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves in the great afternoon, the pastries and food menu seemed very appetizing. But the rest is not all that great, we went about ordering a specialty coffee, an iced hazelnut latte with some small pastries.  The coffee was ok in flavor and nothing all that special, the hazelnut latte seemed to lack flavor and was not well made after a few sips we stop drinking it. The pastries were bland and honestly I've had better at my local starbucks. 

The pick up area for the drinks did not give me confidence either anyone could just walk up to your order and spread any amounts of germs and bacteria without any of the employees having any idea that this sort of thing matters when it comes to your food and drinks.

For what I was charged I expected better and I wasn't impressed, I like the ambiance and the place but besides that I can't see a reason to comeback.

I read a lot of positive reviews about this place so when I was in this part of town I stopped by Sambalatte and ordered a caramel latte and veggie quiche. My hot drink is rather delicious, with a faint hint of caramel and espresso while the veggie quiche was very good. I frequent Sunrise Coffee quite a lot and if I were to compare this drink here with my usual caramel macchiato at Sunrise, I think Sambalatte's caramel latte tasted like it may have more caloric content. So if you are health conscious like me and only like one particular drink, maybe it's better to opt for the one at Sunrise.

If I ever find myself in the NW area of Vegas, I am definitely stopping by here again and try the salmon quiche plus a caramel hot espresso drink!

Items selected:
Nutella Latte
Blueberry Scone
Carrot Muffin
Nutella Bombe
Craquant de Cuba - chocolate crisp, hazelnut coffee cream, shortbread, toffee glaze
Almond, Pistachio, Caramel Macaron
Almond Croissant

Located in Boca Park and representing one of the best artisan coffee shops in a city where such places are only now beginning to emerge Sambalatte was self-selected as an ideal meeting place with my Real Estate Agent early Friday morning, a substantial departure from his suggestion of the Starbucks just down the street but one that has since 'changed his whole approach' to coffee (and given me a great place to relax, drink good coffee, and enjoy the free wi-fi.)  Featuring a large, open floor plan with both patio seating and a loft filled with books, lounge chairs, and a communal table plus an impressive selection of scratch pastries and house-roasted coffees predominantly hailing from Central and South America ordering decisions were placed squarely in my hands, the subsequent 90 minutes covering a good variety of cakes, cookies, scones, muffins, and Viennoiserie plus the shop's oft raved Nutella latte which is every bit as good as the rumors.  Speaking to the quality of the pastry much of what we tasted at Sambalatte was well made save for an almond croissant literally oozing with frangipane and a caramel macaron that had clearly been refrigerated, but taking into account the price none were truly 'rave worthy' save for the blueberry riddled scone and complex Craquant de Cuba which managed a delicate balance of decadent and dainty; each layer presenting something new and the sum far greater than sum of its parts.

Cute little shop! Coffee, service, and food are amazing! I have been coming here for 2 years now and have never had an issue. The shop is always busy and it's sometimes hard to find a place to sit which is the only flaw. For drinks and food, I recommend the rose petal latte and the bran muffin!

I really love this place. It's relaxed and unique. The coffee is good. I have had the Nutella Latte a couple of times. Just perfect. Food is good too. You may have to wait. Grab a table outside on the patio and chill. Sunday morning is some live music.

Expenssive, however we love this place

Large ice latte is simmiler to medium in many other places

clean with nice people

This place has a huge selection of beverages!  My sister got the Sumatra hand poured,  she got it black and it had the best flavor!  My husband got an iced soy latte, very good!  I got an herbal tea called Jet Lag Energy, it was minty and very light and tasty. We will come back for sure. We sat outside on a lovely day!

EXCELLENT COFFEE/LATTES/FRAPPES

Could be cleaner though, the table always need to be wiped and the bathrooms are not the cleanest. 
The cups could be cleaner, they always look spotted and not cleaned enough.

I ordered the Turkey Swiss here today. It was my first time and I can definitely say I'll be back. The lady who took my order was training a new employee at the time, but she made it totally entertaining for me. The place has a cool Steampunk vibe to it. You can dine on the couch, at the tech station, upstairs, and even outside. The food is great and the desserts are insanely good.

The weather was finally nice enough to sit outside and drink a cup of Nutella latte and eat a Nutella Bomb Dome and some macarons. The cafe is pretty, clean and filled with lovely aroma from coffee and desserts.  There's plenty of room to enjoy your drink, chat with friends, surf the internet, read a book or the magazines they have. They had me at Slam magazine - coffee, desserts and basketball! I soooo love this place. There's live music too!

In a town of endless commercial chains hails this posh little cafe that simply shines. They have a selection of coffee, loose leaf teas, and delectable delights. I had the Vanilla Rooibos brewed in a french press. There is a little loft upstairs which is quite a bit more intimate if you want to study or just some quiet, and the lower area has nice little tables outside and cozy areas inside to lounge. I will definitely be back again.

Sambalatte is a hipster coffee oasis. 

The place is filled with what looks like graphic designers, independent writers, and other 30-40-somethings that wouldn't be caught dead in a Starbucks or any sort of commercial chain. If you don't have a MacBook or iPad, don't bother to show up, these are Apple people.

Besides the lack of cultural diversity found in most coffee shops, sambalatte offers a solid and quality coffee experience. It really is a tried and true coffee shop.

I can't give it 5 stars because it is overly priced, it's in Boca Park, and it doesn't offer a variety of other collective-ness that coffee shops (being around the world and US as I have) offer. (The Beat, in downtown LV, is still the only legit coffee shop we have in Vegas.)

Sambalatte is a great spot, they have several great sandwiches, quiches, and an assortment of baked goods that will have you drooling at the counter.

Coffee:
The coffee consist of the very traditional coffee shop fare with a few twists on nutella capuccino. I like that they have pour overs on select beans and that they serve their coffee in real cups as opposed to paper cups. My only complaint is that the coffee just doesn't come out hot enough in their pour overs. I like my coffee steaming when it gets to me. This coffee is definitely not that. Flavor is nice and the beans usually have a good selection of body v. brightness etc. Unfortunately, you don't have much time to enjoy it before your coffee goes cold.

Pastries:
The pastries are not bad though not amazing. I highly recommend the linzer cookies though at $2.50 a pop for a small cookie it is rather steeply priced. I have tried multiple items here including their soups an quiches. Overall verdict is that it is passable but rather disappointing given how expensive each item is. 

Atmosphere: 
Very cool vibe. It is a very traditional coffee shop that I could definitely see as a "third place." Nothing like the tiny cookie cutter coffee shops that permeate the strip malls out here. If you're looking for a place where you can sip and bask in the atmosphere, Samba totally delivers. The chairs are comfy with books shelves and a giant map of the world. Music plays at low level and the hum of activity permeates the air without overwhelming. The only thing I wish it would do is perhaps choose music that didn't thump as much, but other than that definitely a place I would recommend if you want a unique place to enjoy your coffee. 

Btw, for dog lovers the patio has dedicated dog bowls that are adorable, and umbrellas to keep the sun out of your face.

Wow, I love this place!  I've been to one of the other Sambalatte locations in town, but I like this one better.  The upstairs with recliners and little tea tables just adds to the cozy appeal.  Their teas (I've now tried three different kinds) are all great, and my friend - who had the hot chocolate - said that was delicious, as well.   Their Christmas decorations that were up when I went were also adorable and pretty.  Look forward to coming back here, and maybe exploring Boca Park a little more, as well...

This cafe is SO hipster.  We were joking about it before even coming here, and once we arrived, I realized it wasn't a joke at all!  There was lady in the front playing beautiful violin music the whole time (reading from the sheet music on her ipad, ofc).  There's a 2nd story "loft" area so you can overlook the entire cafe area while sipping your handcrafted drink.

With regards to drinks and food, I had the iced white mocha.  Tasted too "thick", and the espresso wasn't very strong.  Sadly I prefer Starbucks white mocha.  Also tried the green tea frappe... came in a 16 ounce size only, so it was $6.  EXPENSIVE!  But it was very good... best matcha frappe I've had in awhile.  Very strong green tea taste, perfect amount of "cream", and the ice was creamy as well.

Also tried the macaron sampler, which was $15 and contained every flavor they offer!  My favorites were the pistachio, coconut, and almond.  Don't let them sit in your car, especially in the 118 degree Vegas heat!!
Best cold brew in town. Every latte is exceptionally good. Friendly staff and management.

Sambalatte is a local coffee café located up in Summerlin. They do have other locations around the city. Anytime I'm in Boca Park and need a coffee this is where I stop. They have a good selection of drinks to choose from and have a cool chill environment. The main reason I give them three stars and not four is because of their iced coffee program. It's somewhat of a train wreck. They offer cold brew in bottles that they say is done fresh every single morning which I find hard to believe. Whether I'm in Vegas, New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, or Europe  every other high end coffee shop (meaning non chain like Starbucks) offers fresh cold brew or fresh iced coffee. Sambalatte are the only ones who bottle the way Starbucks does which has most people believing that they sold out and it's mass produced just like Starbucks, with preservatives just so it lasts in the fridge or on a shelf longer. That's the only real complaint. But if you happen to be in Boca Park Fashion Village and feel like a coffee, espresso, latte, or cappuccino then try them out just say away from the cold brew it's average.

this is a really good place to meet up with people like if you have friends or business partners or even on a date not on like a DATE date but those kinds of dates where you just wanna chat and if you don't like the person you can gulp your coffee and leave anyway i don't have those things so i usually visit by myself or sometimes with one person if i am lucky but it is not a business parter or date it is usually a friend although one time i came here on a date and we wound up dating for six months and it didn't really end well but it wasn't sambalatte's fault they actually probably stretched it out for that sixth month so thanks for that i guess

the hazelnut latte is really good and they do that swirling thing on the foam if you get your coffee there and it's kind of overpriced but you can take pictures for instagram and let everyone know that you got one of those swirly coffees and people will think that your life is grand and rich with experiences

i have never had their food because i usually just want coffee but someday i will try the food i promise

if anyone wants to go on a date to sambalatte please let me know but you have to pay for me unless it is every other friday because that is when i get paid and then we can split it

I had a generally pleasant experience at Sambalatte. This coffee shop is built for those who wish to lounge around and for those who wish to get some work done. The outlet bar provides multiple plugs so no one is encroaching on someone else' space.

I had a large cup of coffee earlier in the day, but had some time to kill. Instead I went with a Ginger Peach Iced Tea and a couple of macarons. I had originally wanted to stop by another pastry shop, down the street, but they are closed on Mondays. Bummed out, I thought I was settling, but they provided some tasty versions of this treat as well. I got one pistachio and one mango. They were both soft and moist on the inside, but the latter replicated the feeling of biting into a piece of fruit so well. I was impressed with both of my choices. My friend had bought some cappuccino and chocolate ones. She loved them, even commenting about how the second one reminded her of a soft brownie. Besides the usual coffee and pastries, Sambalatte offers some delicious looking savory items. I must come back for a meal and that infamous Nutella Latte. 

Sitting outside on the patio during the spring makes makes me regret that this weather is fleeting. Soon our warm and pleasant days will be replaced with a vindictive heat. Until then, sitting in the sun is the way to go.
This is probably the best coffee shop in Summerlin. It's a bit pricey, but the drinks are solid, and the macaroons are to die for.

I looove this location! Mostly because of the second floor that overlooks the rest of the coffee shop. But I came in December and their Christmas decorations are AMAZING. You definitely have to come early if you want to do some work and have a table. It gets packed pretty quick. But other than the decor, the drinks are yummy, too! 

I ordered a hot matcha latte with soy milk and vanilla. It was delicioussss! On all their hot drinks, they do that fancy picture thing with the milk foam. Unfortunately, mine did really look like the bird they were going for. So sadly, no pictures of my drink. Their chai tea latte and Nutella latte are other yummy drinks. 

I only gave four stars because this place is preeeetty pricy. My one drink was already $8 for a regular size. I definitely wouldn't come here on a daily basis. Only when I want a real coffee shop feel.

Have not been here since I moved away.  Used to come every week for a awesome cup of coffee.  It must of changed management.  The coffee is watered down. The pastries are gone. The wait is terrible with slow business.... Overall, I am quite disappointed.

This review is after my third visit. I usually work out of coffee shops so I tried looking for something new. It's very pricey. The lattes are good. The hot tea is good. The pastries are over priced and I had bought that tasted like freezer burn. Who wants to pay high prices for that? I told the employee and she said I had to let it thaw. Really? Wow. After letting it "thaw" for over 10 minutes (she said it would thaw in 2) it was still frozen and had the nasty freezer taste.
Try the Nutella latte :) Its divine! Love the atmosphere and all of the little yummy treats, too. Great for a date night :)

Let me start off by saying their nutella latte is everything. It's a great spot with free WiFi and perfect study spot. I can spend hours here and the vibe the people that come here are equally as peaceful. The prices are a bit high but almost the same as Starbucks. The only difference is this place is 4x bigger than any Starbucks and it has a Parisian ambiance. Love this place and everything on their menu is delicious as well!

Took my friend for a cup a coffee - my first time there, never even heard of this brand before. The place is very cozy, beautiful decor all around, even the floor concrete had a cool design. The bathroom was very clean as well. The staff was friendly and prompt, and as soon as we set down outside my friend said, "wow, this place feels very european!" All of a sudden someone addressed us with a very heavy european accent - it was their server, making sure we were all set to enjoy our coffee. He turned out to be from Europe and was super nice to take probably 8 pictures of us (with 2 phones). 

Now... the coffee we ordered was "Nutella Latte" (we asked for most popular); came out beautiful and in a large cup! We also ordered two pastries: a muffin and an apple danish. My bill for two cups ($5.50 each) and pastry was $17 with change. $5.50 for a cup of coffee is very expensive! But I decided that it was worth it based on the ambience of the place... they did an excellent job decorating and finding authentic decor pieces to display around the register. BUT once I tasted the coffee, it was lukewarm. I was very surprised because every time I order a latte at Coffee Bean or even Starbucks it is always very hot. The taste of my Nutella Latte wasn't anything special at all even though the name sounded very delicious. 

Anyway, we enjoyed our treats and a good conversation on their patio for about two hours and at the end when we were leaving my friend never mentioned anything about the coffee even though she told me she really enjoyed the pastry. I can only assume that her latte wasn't great either. Long story short, YOU PAYING $5.50 for a cup of coffee at Sambalatte is basically you paying $3.50 for lukewarm but beautiful large size latte PLUS $2 for tips already included like in some places in Europe.... At the end of the day, Sambalatte reminded me of France... pretty, too expensive and overrated!  I think Coffee Bean's latte for $3.50 tastes way better and is easier on your wallet especially when you invite a friend. I don't think I will be returning to this place, may be only to take pictures of the decor. ;-)

Oh it's 113 degrees, what do you want to do? Go drink a delicious hot Nutella latte that's what. 

Sambalatte has live music, great decor, books and magazines to peruse, and a bunch of yummy desserts and pastries to munch on.

Sambalatte is my favorite coffee shop for so many reasons. Their coffee and espresso drinks are excellent. My favorite drink is the Mocha, but every drink I have had has been amazing. The baristas are incredibly sweet and friendly. I am torn as to whether I love the staff or the coffee more. The food and pastries are delicious. They serve the best almond croissant I have ever had. And their ham and brie sandwich tastes like Paris. 

Prices are lower than Starbucks and the quality of their product is unparalleled. I love the two-story layout and the live music on the weekends. I can't say enough good things about this place. I absolutely adore Sambalatte. Best coffee in Las Vegas.

Nice upscale coffee shop in front of MC.  We had cappuccino, very artistically done and delicious.

Selections of deserts and sandwiches and such.

We would return.
Best coffee house I've ever been in. They take their coffee seriously. Great atmosphere, Super nice location, Cool baristas. The BEST caramel machiatto I've EVER had!

First of all i don't really understand why I was charged full price ($3.75) for a small chocolate cappuccino and given only half of a cup?! (see picture). I also don't see any reason to pay almost $3 for a cup of tea while you can get exactly the same one in Starbucks for $1.50
Employees were neither rude nor super friendly.  I would say kind of pretentious just like the rest of the clientele that come to this place. 
My cranberry muffin was really fresh, tasty (and expensive ).

I was driving to Arkansas and I decide to stop in las vegas for overnight in the sin city.. I decide to taste the coffee in a local store. I order simple cappuccino.. It was awesome! But the awesome starts with the Barista making sure the coffee is prepare the right way.. To be able to seat and enjoy the ambiance with your coffee is priceless!

I came back to try the loose leaf. I was disappointed to see the tea tins were dusty and obviously don't sell well. I guess since this is more a coffee shop than tea place I should not be surprised. I will stick to the coffee!
Super cute place to come and study or just relax, good drinks and pastries! A bit pricey though!

This is a great place to get coffee.  The atmosphere is awesome.  It's clean, relaxing, and cozy.  The amazing coffee, and pastry smells don't hurt either.
I've heard that there are board games upstairs, but I have yet to make it up there, because it's always packed when I stop in.  
The service is awesome, but can be a bit slow when they're busy (which seems like most of the time now).  No biggie, the hand crafted nutella cappuccinos are totally worth the wait. 
I will keep visiting as long as I can still find a seat.

Hands down the best 'local' coffee shop in Las Vegas. You are far from the tourists, far from the ghetto and yet still close enough to nicer area of Vegas. This place is located in Boca Park, for sure one of my LEAST favorite areas in Vegas, but I still head over from time to time to have a latte here because it is simply the best.

When you walk in you can almost sense the hipster vibe that is starting to manifest. However, if you ignore most of the other patrons and just enjoy the ambiance it is still a great experience. Sometimes they have live music, some guitar playing or light music in the background.  I don't mind it but sometimes those guitarists are a bit overwhelming for a calm coffee sipping experience.

Now on to their coffee. Most places carry B or C grade coffee. Think starbucks carries B grade so mostly everywhere else is C grade. Sambalatte carries only the best, imported beans and they know their stuff. If you have questions or want something special they probably have it or can help you get it. They are very knowledgeable about their product-something most other places aren't.

I recommend this place to people who know and appreciate good espresso. And no one else!

It was really busy when I visited but I still found it to be a relaxed atmosphere even though it was kind of crowded. They have lots of little cafe tables inside but they are pretty densely pack so it's tough to pick your way through. A friend and I had tea here which was reasonably priced and served in a tea press which was nice. I also had a ham and Brie sandwich which I thought was a little over priced at $10. We tried the cappuccino macaroons but the flavor was really weird. I liked that they had a cute little upstairs balcony to utilize all the space. They also have outdoor seating. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I would visit again and hope to catch it at a less busy time.
Loved loved loved loved it !!! Food was delicious and smoothie forget about it ! haha. Delicious!
One of my favorite coffee place  in whole town. Everything from food to design of the place is giving a chance to have a good time along or with friends.

This was my second visit to this place. They have decent coffee and their prices are comparable to other coffee shops in the area. The Batistas are friendly and prompt. 

This coffee shop has a good atmosphere to work in and offers comfortable seating. It can get a bit cramped,  but the upstairs seating and bookshelves leave the place with a good vibe.

A while back, I was living in SLC, UT for 6 years. I slowly became a coffee drinker since the winter in SLC was pretty long and chilly :) I was introduced to this great coffee shop called, 'Salt Lake Roasting Co.' which is located in downtown area. I loved this place because of their cozy atmosphere and the great taste of coffee. I am very happy to find out that Sambalatte is opened in town :)   My favorite aspect of Sambalatte is the atmosphere!!  Just like the one(SLRC) in SLC...The downstairs is a little bit bigger than the upstairs area (loft style, big wooden table with a plenty of comfy chairs & sofas, board games, books, magazines, & new papers are available to use). There are various sizes of tables you can set up on free wi-fi as well, awesome!! 
If you are a espresso drinker, I recommend a 'Affogato with Vanilla Gelato'-it's simply put, a shot of espresso with a scoop of your choice of gelato in it.  I usually get a regular coffee(Sumatra) and it is divine! When I order my coffee, the barista pours water over the coffee bean grounds, stirring them, and pouring the water (A hand drip coffee, yay :P)  But more importantly, the service was out of this world. All the staff were friendly, nice, and helpful. They also provide you a drink card (ask a barista before you pay). It is a great local coffee option if you want to do your work or hang out in a relaxed atmosphere.  You don't get hassled or interrupted.

Their specialty coffees are really delightful and smooth. I haven't had their plain coffee yet but I am willing to try it cause what i've had so far makes me sad to go back to Starbucks. 

I love a good latte and they make them super foamy(!) and with a pretty flower design on top (!!). Then they serve it in a big,fat mug and I dont even need to add sugar. 

Great place to also chill with a laptop(free wifi) and "study" with a drink and maybe a snack. 

Sambalatte would get 5 stars if they fixed their food side. I would like it if there were signs so I could see what so-and-so is. When there's a long line behind you I feel bad asking the guy to explain everything to me and he has to look it up 'cause he's not sure either.

Finally a REAL coffee shop in town and in a great area too. Only reason for not giving 5 stars is, even though they have single origin coffees from multiple locations around the globe, they still slightly over-roast the beans. Being a home coffee roaster for a few years now, you really appreciate it when a shop will roast the bean based upon its character and not just to suit the masses (s-bucks)

What a great find. Absolutely love the Parisian flare. Everything about the cafe is was fun. Very creative latte's, we went to have dessert and coffee. I ate every crumb of my apple tart. LOL My daughter had mint tea and it was perfect. Yes we are going back. I went to breakfast here on Friday with some new friends and we had the best time. This is a winner.

I have been here with groups people, I've camped out in the corner by myself, and I have met friends here for intimate chats. No matter what your agenda, Sambalatte has only one goal: serve you great coffee and comestibles at decent prices in an inviting atmosphere.

The science-fiction-esque cold drip, hourglass-shaped gravity pots are not only fun to watch but make a damn fine cup of coffee, too. It's something you can't rush, however; give yourself plenty of time to let the coffee brew; it takes about 10-15 minutes just for the coffee part, not including the setup and delivery. Three to five cups of coffee in each one (depending on you and how you consume or doctor your coffee) make it worth the price.

I also loved the Nutella Latte. Not too sweet, the flavor was a well-balanced mix of the Nutella flavor we all know and love (and if you don't, we can't be friends anymore! ;)) and a rich coffee roast. Perfect.

The teas are bold and fresh, too, and I particularly liked a green and black blend (unsweetened) that I had. Pair it with some fresh fruit (either a cut plate or whole) and you have a fantastic Vegas summer snack.

The cheese plate was better than some high-end establishments I have frequented, quiches are light on texture and heavy on flavor, and the desserts are... diabetic coma, anyone? You can share any of it, the portions are that good (and, let's face it, the more you share the more you can order and taste!).

The rating comes from amazing experiences every time I go. It is worth all the we're-in-Summerlin-we're-exclusive hype? Nope, not at all. It's mostly hype... 

... however, look past that, over the heads of the wannabes and the want-to-haves (there are always a few, people watching is GREAT!), and you find some fun, engaging, coffee-loving folks who enjoy patronizing even more fun, engaging, coffee-loving folks who make great drinks and tasty, fresh food for any craving. 

That is what makes this place awesome. Add to that reasonable prices, live music, cozy decor, and a good location, and it's definitely worth it.

BEST coffee in Vegas.

Parking is a pain. Finding a seat during busy hours is a pain. But the fact that I've never been there to find it NOT busy is a testament to the fact that this place has the

BEST coffee in Vegas.

If you can get a good seat, the ambiance is also quite nice, despite the fact that everybody and their uncle is there, but that's because this place has the 

BEST coffee in Vegas.

more locations coming soon:
http://www.reviewjournal.com/business/retail/qa-luiz-claudio-oliveira-owner-and-operator-sambalatte-torrefazione

It makes me sad to write this update, but it has to be done.

My very good friend Brenda celebrated her 50th birthday yesterday and she wanted to do two things to celebrate it:  have her favorite VPN pizza down the street at Village Square and then have her favorite chocolate cappuccino here at Sambalatte.  Simple, right?  Well, no, apparently not.

Anyone who knows me knows that I've been a big fan of Sambalatte since it opened.  I've been coming here for a while and I even introduced Brenda to this cafe and to my favorite drink, the chocolate cappuccino, which then became her favorite drink.
Now, I'd noticed already on prior visits that if you arrive close to closing time, your drink will be served in a to-go cup, which I thought made sense because they were about to close in a few minutes.  However, we arrived at precisely 7:54pm and they were closing at 9:00pm.  When Brenda placed her order, she was told that her beloved chocolate cappuccino would be served in a to-go cup. 
 "Why is that?" Brenda asked.  
 "Because we're closing in an hour.  It's the owner's policy," replied the Samba lady.
  "OK, but it's 7:54," Brenda replied. (We know this because the three of us all checked our cellphones right then.)
 "It says 8:00pm on my clock," "says the Samba lady.
  "OK, but it's only 7:54pm AND it's her birthday,"  I chimed in.
  "Sorry, but it's the owner's policy.  We can't change it. If we serve the drinks in the porcelain cups, people hang around."

Is this not a cafe?  If we wanted to-go cups, we could have gone to one of the chains.  If you don't want people to "hang around," why are you in business?  Is it too much trouble to wash your cups at night?
Now we know.  Brenda placed her Sipping Rewards card on the counter, we turned around, and went to the cafe at Tivoli Village.  They served us pleasantly and Brenda got her birthday chocolate cappuccino just like she wanted.
This may not seem like a big deal to anyone but us. Brenda just wanted to enjoy her drink with the leaf design and hang out for an hour as she's done on several prior visits.  There are lots of people who love Sambalatte as I have. They won't notice that they lost us as customers. I get it .  But, you don't treat loyal customers like that, especially if they're my friends.  End rant.

I have tried almost every macron place in vegas. This place has one of the best.  So much flavor and sooo chewy in the middle. Plus they have entertainment every time I go. I don't know if it's every day but I seem to be there the times they have some kind of entertainment. Love this place
Tiramisu is terrible!  Whipped cream covered lady fingers with no flavor.  So disappointing.

vegas is getting there... there aren't a lot of coffeehouse options on the NW side of town (i dont do starbucks) so minus the yuppies and the posers, it is a good place for a decent cup of chai. the pastries are delish too!

I have been hearing about this place FOREVER. I had a professor at UNLV that just raved about this place, so much so, that people did presentations about this place in his class. Yeah. 

This morning, (3/26/14) I accidently got up an hour early to make it to my gym class, only to remember that it started at 9 AM. It's located at Flamingo and Durango, so I decided to grab some coffee. I couldn't find any place that was open driving up Durango, so I pulled out Yelp and saw Sambalatte was nearby. 

I thought the place was closed because the windows had the blinds drawn, as the building faces east. I went up to the door and that's when I saw that there were people inside. 

Sigh. I was dressed for my workout and everyone else looked like they were about to broker a real estate deal. Great. While everyone else raves about how people bring their computers down here and work, I absolutely hate that people do that. Coffee shops aren't mobile offices. When everyone is writing their "Great American Novel" or intervewing a prospective nanny, it's nearly impossible to 1. find a seat 2. relax & enjoy your purchase.

I ordered a large black iced coffee and a spinach & feta crustless quiche that is maybe 4 inches in diameter. My total came out to $11. I was trying to figure out why it was so high until I saw that these quiches are $8 a piece. I told the cashier to take it off my order, plus it would take over 8 minutes to heat it up (according to the cashier) and I didn't have time for that. I don't care how you market yourself, a quiche smaller than my hand isn't worth that much. Value is always an important quality to me.

My iced coffee, was basically a large cup of ice with some coffee added in. The coffee - wow. Acrid & almost green tasting, like it had notes of grass. Terrible. There's no milk or half and half at their bar, so I couldn't cut the bitterness. 

Not impressed, won't be back.

I really enjoy this location, I love the decor and the atmosphere. The big comfy chairs upstairs, YES, they have an upstairs loft area that I absolutely LOVE! The small library upstairs is fun to digest and ample workspace available as well. Bathrooms are clean and there is a lovely outdoor area for seating as well. I enjoy meeting individuals here for business meetings.
We opened a clothing store next to sambalate in June 2014 the coffee there is so good I have not missed a day with out there coffee since then. Service is great. Longer wait but worth it.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Sambalatte's coffee.  Super smooth and rich.  AND the snack / lunch offerings are wonderful.  Try EVERYTHING... all the different ways to drink your coffee... all the different flavors.  Learn something new about something you drink every day!  AND their presentation (with latte art!) is So much fun!

The coffee and atmosphere is what makes the experience here one of a kind. Overall sambalatte is an excellent place to sip and savor delicious coffee, however it is a bit pricey. One macaroon (mind you, they are not full sized) costs about $1.75. The iced Nutella latte is bomb as well as the mocha. They're not overly sweet like Starbucks.. You can still taste the coffee which is what I love!

One flat white with two raw sugars, please!

Love this European-style coffee spot so much. The coffee is amazing, the snacks are so fresh (not like most stale baked goods usually served at cafés), the vibe is perfect for hanging out solo or meeting a few friends... Oh, and dog-friendly outside! 

This place is fantastic, and I think people are starting to catch on. Hands down, favorite hangout spot in Vegas.
Awesome coffee and small plate food offerings. The food, like the coffee is excellent, the prices, not so much. For me this a once in a while rare treat.

Wow how disappointing ! Tiny ceramic cup of latte cost over $4 TINY! Over priced. They come out and tell you that your order is ready :/ the time it took them to come out and tell you they should of brought it out!! For the price you pay  

Your paying for the decor & I guess boca park is the best Neighbour hood summerlin/ Vegas has to offer. Let's stare at the parking Lott and pay out our nose for it! 

 
Poor service and over prices and the coffee cup sizes make no sense.

What a delightful little place! 

Came mid week to meet a friend for coffee. The downstairs was pretty full with people studying or on their laptops. There was live music which was really nice too. 

The baristas were both really  nice. I ordered the Nutella latte, per recommendation. It was perfect. 

Overall a great experience.  I will definitely come here to study or work. Awesome relaxing but interesting vibe.
"5" across the board. Organic Coffee! Several interesting books to read and relax in upper loft! Delicious food, great service.

My absolute favorite coffee shop to hang out at and get some work done on laptop. Which means free wifi (password on receipt) and lots is space to sit. I first came here when I was visiting Las Vegas and thought it was such a nice quiet area. I've recently moved and live ten minutes away ! Lots of parking , good customer service, excellent coffee!

The best coffee in Las Vegas. The staff is knowledgable on the products and incredibly kind. 

Beyond, the coffee this is a great place to meet with people or get away and work using their free wi-fi. 

The coffee is slightly more expensive than other coffee shops in the area, but the quality of the coffee makes it worth it.

After reading rave reviews, I decided to take my coffee loving husband here one Sunday. The place was bursting at the seams, despite the warm weather. It is really long inside, almost like a hallway and there isn't a ton of seating. There are about 3 tables upstairs, 2 booths in the front, and a mess of tables in the middle.
